UTVV-ZPw-Cf6tvkK9FVT4A.text: This is an incredible restaurant. I went there with my family for Easter brunch and was so impressed by the food, service, and ambience of the restaurant. We were able to order from both the special Easter brunch menu and their regular lunch menu.   We started with calamari, which is the best I've ever had. The breading on it was not overwhelming and it was perfectly cooked. Half of the table ordered blackened salmon (with linguine) and the other half ordered sea scallops and risotto--both were impeccable. The salmon was well-seasoned and cooked to order, the pasta sauce tasted fresh and homemade. I was especially impressed by the scallops. I have often had overcooked scallops but these were tender and flavorful. The risotto was out of this world. Again, everything so fresh.   The service was wonderful. They were polite, friendly, and accommodating, checked on us, and offered us a rack to put our purses on. They kept our waters full, and our tables clean.  On a side note, I was also very happy with their restrooms. Often, restrooms are neglected or unkempt. On the contrary, this restroom was very clean, stylish, and they had the best quality toilet paper and paper towels to use. They even had Listerine for use as well. It's the attention to detail that makes the difference.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone, and will definitely be returning. It made our Easter brunch very special.

Q1FhKeJ3VVd5vSDZECUpIQ.text: I've been wanting to come to this restaurant for a long time and finally got the chance tonight! They checked off every item on my list! It's really quite a pretty restaurant. They have a pizza oven behind the bar which kind of sets the ambiance and really simple black and white table clothes. As I sat down our waiter brought me my own personal purse rack so my bag didn't sit on the floor. I've never had that happen before at a restaurant! Such great service. I think our server was Chelsea and she checked on us often and was very friendly. They were prompt with water and bread and it was hot and delicious.  For dinner I ordered the veal Marsala which was perfect! It wasn't breaded which I love and the sauce had beautiful portobello mushrooms in it. As good as that was, I think the angel hair pasta on the side was even better. Just simple marinara and it was delicious! I had a lovely martini and wedge salad before which were also awesome. And we finished with tiramisu. They did the tiramisu right, too!  Definitely worth it. Delicious and superb service!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tiramisu
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veal scaloppini with delicious pasta on the side!

Whz2NORnRazU1DD6SUQBVQ.text: We really enjoyed this place! It was lovely and the prices were very reasonable. The food was absolutely delicious and the service great! We will definitely go back!

W49-gvbzqjMIZyI4GYpt3g.text: I now have a favorite Italian Resturaunt in town! The Bread is So good that its a problem.

_paV3m0_0AQIo_N4WWzGIQ.text: I was soo excited to go here since I drive pass it very day. The patio looked gorgeous and I love sitting outside. So finally my girlfriend and I had a late lunch on a Friday. It was a very good day to sit in the patio area.  Mo was our waiter.. His customer service was on point. Very tentative. However, the food was ok. I gave them a 3 1/2 stars but rounded up to 4..  I had the 3 course lunch because as usual my eyes is bigger than my stomach...  1st course: Creaser salad. Full size salad. It was very bland..  2nd course: seared fish with mashed potatoes, green beans and some kind of flavor butter with sliced almonds. Again, it was bland and oily.. However, the fish was seared very nicely. Nice crunch to it. I liked it.  3rd course: dessert. I can't remember...  Overall, I would go back. I'm guessing they still need to work out their kinks. I heard the waitress told her customers, they haven't had their grand opening yet!!! So I will definitely be back and try something else.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch spaghetti and meatballs
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pan seared fish with some kind of flavor butter, green beans and slices almonds

Iq8Ok1u_d72LLGv9ZE14Gw.text: Went on a Monday night, so it was pretty quiet. We brought our own wine and the server nicely chilled both bottles for us. Food was yummy!

HmhLUT-hxyAX42b_2602Vg.text: So I saw the great reviews on Yelp and was looking for an amazing Italian place to take my parents who were visiting. You gotta have a reservation which I didn't know but since we were early they were super accommodating. The baked goat cheese appetizer was delish. I had the ravioli al forno and it was amazing. Basically everything is good. You can't go wrong. We will definitely be back!!

52kxbIoLG4PeBMFJnZ7poA.text: This place has good authentic Italian food. Really enjoy the simple white decor inside the restaurant. Tables are a little small and ten inside of the restaurant is noisy. My wife and enjoy enjoy the coziness of the bar and flat screen tvs. A nice assortment of cocktails. Wine selection is ok. You get a complimentary bread w marina sauce the bread is good but sauce is so so.  Food a little pricey and parking is nonexistent. Love the canolis.

KwSnzEOKnNULxMnVukUv3w.text: I went to the restaurant with my group of friends for a birthday celebration. We had an amazing  time. Food was awesome and service well. Prices are fair and location is very convenient... Mushroom ravioli with the lobster... Best dish..

2SqBrTR9x7tsDC50y39h7g.text: Let me explain..FIVE STARS for valet parking, excellent service, excellent atmosphere, excellent ambience, excellent dessert. THREE STARS for our dinner which was such a bummer. Again beautiful presentation but the taste lacked. The Fettuccine Alfredo was runny almost a soup needed heavy cream and a egg yolk to thicken in our opinion. The mushroom ravioli was ok, needed more sauce and maybe a tad more salt. The baked goat cheese dip was yummy and the bread was very tasty. Overall taste experience lacked but all other aspects shined.

Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beautiful presentation: a macchiato after dinner

8tyJhygsIRe06R-LsTknhg.text: I love this place. Their goat cheese appetizer with bread is just unreal. Who would have known it was that good?  I think their lasagna is some of the best, as well. They use thin sheets of pasta and I think it provides just the right texture. Tried the chicken parm, homemade chips and so many other items. All delicious.

6Xo7z443-9rS8WDTnSrKpw.text: From the moment we sat down, the service was excellent. Our server was so polite and knowledgeable, but didn't talk too much.  The complimentary bread and sundried tomato/olive oil antipasto were so good that we ended up getting full on them. Oops. Husband and I both got the 12.95 three course lunch special- Caesar salad, grouper panini, and tiramisu; tomato bisque, pesto fusilli, and panna cotta. The food was SPECTACULAR. I'll just speak for my food. The tomato bisque was so creamy but didn't taste like heavy cream. The pesto was rich and the texture of the shrimp was so fresh. The little bits of fresh mozzarella appropriate too. And that custard!! Wow. Just the right amount of seeetness and not heavy. We both have a ton of leftovers from our entrees for dinner. We will definitely be going back. What a pleasant and satisfying dining experience!! Thank you, Luciano's!!

9OBPrZDB-7-UjycufpnZJQ.text: I ordered Caesar Salad, Vegetarian Panini, pannacote and cappuccino. It was wonderful!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dessert was marvelous -- cappuccino &amp; pannacotte were heavenly.

Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States

PzJCs3SNYZJAWhL8no21Xw.text: This is the second time we had eaten at Lucianos with the first time being brunch about two years ago. Something must have changed...management, chef, owner...because this was NOT the same culinary experience that we had before. I ordered the bolognese, and it tasted like canned sauce. It was thick, more tomato sauce than meat or chopped veggies, and coated the pasta like tomato paste. It was nothing at all like an authentic bolognese. My husband had a pizza that arrived half cooked. The dough was literally stark white and doughy. If you are looking for authentic, Italian food, do NOT eat here.

Ay1m0re6QQyondS7hm18GA.text: Yesterday we had My daughter's Birthday Party at Luciano's. What a wonderful afternoon it was. I had not been there before and being a Foodie and Italian I was anxious to try it! What a great surprise ! Everything was fantastic --from the beautiful decor to the scrumptious and authentic food! We had a waiter...If you go you must ask for him --Mauro! He was from New York and an experienced waiter is what every one wants but you don't always get...He took all of our orders...16 people ( big group in a side private room --perfect ) with out writing anything down..He remembered everything..he was spot on...he suggested things for the big party..how many apps to get and what was fantastic and what was on the menu for Restaurant week. We had about 5 or 6 people get the Queens Feast menu...and the rest of us ordered off the regular menu. Their cocktail list is fresh and inviting..Mixology at its finest with fresh herbs and fruit. One of the cocktails was a Blueberry Sage infused Martini! Delicious.. another was a Strawberry Basil mash that was so fresh and light! Now on to the food....We started out with light an crispy Calamari: Hand-battered and fried with sauteed bell peppers, aioli and pomodoro sauce. Then My personal favorite: CARPACCIO: Black Angus beef tenderloin, shaved authentic Parmigiano, baby arugula, crispy capers, truffle oil, and aioli--if you have never had a Fried Caper..you have missed out!! Huge platters - Mauro knew exactly how many for us to get for the crowd we had. I could not get past the fantastic appetizers, so that is what I had for my dinner..I had the BURRATA: Fresh mozzarella with a creamy curd center, heirloom cherry tomatoes, balsamic reduction, and grilled country bread. That was my first course. my second and entree was the BONE MARROW AL FORNO : Served with grilled Ciabatta,roasted garlic and sea salt. Outstanding..three large bones and a great side of the roasted garlic. Some of the other entrees, that my family tried were the PUMPKIN GNOCCHI: Duck, mushroom ragu, outstanding, the Chicken under a Brick with Kale and roasted fingerling potatoes. They had an incredible tableside Dover Sole MEUNIERE, the Manager deboned it! The Steak was also wonderful which is different for an Italian place but so tender and succulent. All of the pasta's were wonderful too. Great wine list to go with the Cocktail and the desserts...well let me just say to any good Italian..."ZEPPOLES" :Ricotta Cheese Filled Italian Doughnuts with Nutella ..enough said.. Heaven on a plate...I would highly recommend this place...Ask for Mauro....Ciao!

U62RaGiSHdAGHXgxHJnLOw.text: Absolutely fabulous! Dined here at Yelp's suggestion and was not disappointed. Charcuterie plate, pasta, wine, and dessert was fabulous and the service was excellent. Took a chef friend who had been working at an ultra high end restaurant in Manhattan and she said that this was the best restaurant experience she'd had in a long time.

lwnXArs5iJQFmmocHx1Mcw.text: First and foremost Luciano's is a clean restaurant, with very fresh food and friendly staff. I have eaten here about 6 times. Our waiter claimed that the owner was a meat wholesaler and he had first crack at quality products. The Chicken Parma is the best I have ever had due to the freshness of the chicken and the preparation.  I do have a problem with this place and several other "Italian" restaurants in Charlotte. The ownership group being from Latin America does a great job, but the red sauce here is not a priority for them. I love red sauce at Italian places and their red sauce is not great. Fiamma is also has Argentinian roots and does a bad job with the sauce.  Also what Italian place have you ever heard of that puts sun dried tomatoes on the table in oil for dipping bread?   In summary you will enjoy your meal here, but if you expect red sauce reminiscent of Italy, Boston, New York or Philadelphia.....your not going to get it.

UbPNNepD4Esefyqwrf3nrQ.text: I have dined here twice for dinner since my first review.  This last time, I noted on my credit card bill that there was an additional $1 added to the charge for a tip.  This is completely unacceptable and unprofessional, and I will not return.

hG4WXbn6abFjHnQUjrZalw.text: Solid neighborhood Italian spot. We've gone several times, and never been disappointed.   Service, wine, food, and ambiance is great.

9h5-iGtM6YAQickrka9UhA.text: I came here for dinner on a Saturday. Even though it was a full house I was seated quickly. My date's steak came out pretty rare, when he ordered it so it was sent back. The second time it came out, the middle was still pretty medium rare. HOWEVER, the manager was extremely pleasant & very accommodating. He comp-d our whole entire meal. I have never experienced such generosity at any restaurant I've ever been to. Yes, usually a discount, or a drink is taken off the bill which is what I normally would expect, but 2 salads, my veal parmesan, and his steak were taken off. He also had a complimentary salad to go. What a great businessman ! I'm definitely coming back, and recommending this place to my friends as well. The veal was cooked perfectly ! Perfect amount of breading as well as a generous amount of cheese. PHENOMENAL service too ! Bravo :)

K-jE-VeKuE49i_5iLRX3Dg.text: Came here for my little sister's Birthday party , I ordered the chicken Marsala and Cesar salad . The chicken came with cooked spinach and mushrooms . The chicken had no favor and wasn't that good for the price . The Cesar salad on the other hand was pretty tasty for a extra $6 . The waitress was friendly . But the food took  forever to get to the table  everyone at the table was filling up in bread . If I came back I would prefer to get the linguine carbonara instead .

J-3e9uDaCf6qumzj8szPDw.text: Don't get the mushroom ravioli. You only get five ravioli pieces...for $18. Very disappointed. This should be under the small plates/starters category. The alfredo sauce was too salty and the ravioli pasta was a little hard as if they weren't boiled long enough. I was also upset that they couldn't make the eggplant parmigiana for me like they did the first time I visited. This was my second visit, and likely my last. Paid for an $18 "entree" that left me feeling hungry. I could've easily ate a whole second plate of five ravioli pieces. Come on, over $3 per ravioli piece...seriously?

kOyuexZINIgk7HuLElqPTw.text: The three courses lunch for $14.99 is very nice and reasonably priced. I had a tomato bisque soup, shrimp pizza with pesto and sundries tomatoes for my entree and Panna cotta for dessert. I like the soup and the pizza. I am not impressed with the Panna Cotta. I do love their drippings (Oliver oil and sundried tomatoes) for the bread.

H9KrvlOrlnqZizD_R9a__A.text: Stellar Italian food! I was passing through Charlotte for the night and thank Yelp for helping me pick a top notch Italian restaurant!  I went at 7:30pm on a Friday night. They had no Open Table times left, but I called them at 6pm, and they had seating for two people available. We ended up eating at the bar with comfortable chairs (great back support too).  The entire restaurant had a classy ambiance and high-end design with live music.   They provide complimentary fresh bread and a yummy red dipping sauce.  I ordered their gnocchi and it was FANTASTIC! My all-time favorite gnocchi is at Filomena in Georgetown, and Luciano's gnocchi was extremely comparable, definitely my top 2 favorites now. It was smothered in cheeses and flavors that made me eat the entire plate!  There is some parking nearby, but it was easier to Uber there. You will want to after having their amazing craft cocktails. I had a fresh strawberries and vodka cocktail that was delightful.   For two meals and four drinks, we spent less than $100. It's great with friends or date night! Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry vodka craft cocktail, YUM!
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. You cannot go wrong with the gnocchi!!

cq0SpVcXUGVtx2a-SHAUtA.text: The bartender was really good and made some hand-crafted cocktails based on our preferences.  Very nice.  Excellent Italian food...well-made, fresh, tasty with decent-sized portions...not huge, but enough that I didn't have to take home leftovers.  A nice, acoustic guitar player in the corner.  So glad he didn't have it amped.  A lot of restaurants that have music let the players use amplifiers and then you just end up with everyone in the restaurant raising their voices and it gets way too loud, so thank you for letting me talk in a normal voice while listening to nice, live music.  Overall the restaurant is quietly elegant and people are wearing nice clothes and talking quietly amongst themselves and enjoying a wonderful evening with wonderful food and ambience.  Cheers to a restaurant and people that appreciate that dining out in Charlotte doesn't mean being unnervingly loud.

rJUqsCCGqxWiI2_rxi6-vg.text: I went last night for the first time and it's a very upscale, adult, quiet atmosphere which I loved! I had salad and pasta. the salad was pretty standard, my berry mojito has great and the Shrimp Fra Diavolo was incredible - by far the best version of the dish I've ever had.

wH8XTQ4xkQuKxnmL1ZeLMw.text: Of the many restaurants I've gone to from Las Vegas to Charleston South Carolina to New York in the last year this might have been one of the finest meals and service I have had. And, very cost-effective! The Chilean sea bass was out of this world as well as every other item that the three of us selected for our meal. And don't forget the bar and bartender were outstanding.

rEVYlerspQXZuwDHoxDyZA.text: Really hate to do this. We have frequented this restaurants plenty of times before. But tonight was Subpar at best. The service was subpar as well, what happened to the nice attentive waitstaff.? Anytime you have to ask for water on multiple occasions is not a good sign inside of a empty restaurant.   Will not be back for awhile.

Bj7Ms1VQHOWU20SdCDuCzg.text: I think Luciano's is one of the nicer resturant's in Charlotte. It isn't over priced and it isn't overly fancy or pretentious. I feel perfectly comfortable here in Blue Jeans and nice shirt. I normally get the Filet Migon, which I again is one of the better one's I have in Charlotte. The sides of Brussell Sprouts and Fingerling potatoes are good. They have a great desert selection. Our party of 4 had 4 Filet's, and 3 different deserts. All were very good. They also have a good wine selection. You can't go wrong making this a special date night, or taking someone here from our of town that you want to show a good time, without being way too expensive.

LVm559EBzjXZqOjdlkFhzg.text: Excellent italian food served for Queens's Feast 2018. I enjoyed the short rib meatballs, butternut squash stuffed Agnolotti pasta, and Napoleon cake with Cappuccino.  Worth coming back again!

PXU3P1taXLnPaz6i1d2v8Q.text: Some of the food at this restaurant is decent but the whole experience is not worth the 5 stars many reviewers give it.  I was tempted to give it a 2 star rating but I figured 3 is a good rating for an average restaurant.    The decor of this place is beautiful...a far change from what used to be there before.    My friends and I were seated at a table next to the window. The place was not too busy when we arrived on a Saturday night but it quickly filled up.    The odd thing is that our server explained the dinner specials before even taking our drink order.  I ordered a Chianti which was about average in my book.  I later switched to a dirty martini which the first one came without olives?  Our server said he would go get some but they never arrived.    Maybe this is a new trend but wine glasses are not even filled halfway anymore and they still charge you $8 or more for the wine.  Also here, they charge you for the vodka and add another charge for a martini.  I just thought that was strange.  And $10.00 for a martini with the house vodka.  Ouch.   This place serves bread with a marinara like dipping sauce which was quite tasty.  One of two things today that were worth my money.  I ordered the lasagna and a chopped salad.   The salad came out right away and it was tasty with an Italian vinagrette dressing.  The lasagna looked more like a gourmet casserole with what looked like wide egg noodles instead of lasagna noodles.  It looked appetizing but once I bit into it, there was no flavor...no garlic, no Italian spice flavors.  Shame.  I actually had to smother it with red pepper flakes to give it some flavor.  Service was really hit and miss.  It took forever for the entrees to come out.  It took forever for a second round of drinks.   Overall,  this place is average.  Average food that you can find and the run of the mill Italian place and average service.  Dinner prices are reasonable.  They have a few expensive items like chilean sea bass and a few others but where they get you is with drinks.   The kicker is that my friends and I still do not know why this place has a higher rating than Fiamma on the the other side of Dilworth.  Fiamma is by far better than this.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lasagna

fN62ewFCt9koyht1zPjiSQ.text: Appetizer was delicious. I had the Burrata and highly recommend. Entree which was steak and an encrusted tomato and mushrooms. It was good. But the dessert was not good. I had to order something different. Service was great. I did go during restaurant week which seems to be the worse time go. Willing to go back and try something on the regular menu. Oh the tiramesu was delicious!

r3UpTn_rl84wyQCClitjhQ.text: The food was great! Chilean sea bass, chicken picatta and the grilled lobster is so awesome!!!!!!! Our server; Claudia, was very nice and knowledgeable.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken picatta, grilled lobster, Chilean sea bass

l_g06UCYcQircG39x3QiSw.text: Overall, fancy Italian in South End with high prices but underwhelming food.   Valet - check White tablecloths - check  Extensive wine list - check Pricey entrees - check Flavorful, quality food - ...   I was very underwhelmed with the food, especially considering how high the prices were. I had the gnocchi ($18), wedge salad, and tried the veal osso bucco ($29). Given the high reviews and prices, I expected the food to be better. It was all fine, but we could have gotten a better meal for half the price that I would have been happier with elsewhere.   Save this place for date nights where food isn't the highlight of the evening.

iLU7B_ZxiIhsH_1Ax83NCg.text: We loved Luciano's the first time we ate here! So we were excited to come again! I made a 7:45 reservation for last night 11/3/16. When we arrived there were several people waiting at the front. We were told they were running late so we would have to wait. We attempted to get a drink at the bar but it was full. Everyone was eating there so it wasn't feasible to squeeze in to order a drink. So we joined the crowd at the front.  At some point the hostess said the manager was offering each of us a drink from the bar which was nice. She later brought flatbread which we passed on because I didn't want to spoil my pasta dinner I was excited about!  Needless to say, after waiting ONE HOUR for our 7:45 RESERVATION, we walked out! Who wants to eat at 9:00?!?! The manager followed us out & said a table was leaving shortly & we would be seated. We declined & kept walking!  I understand restaurants get busy & you can't always get seated on time, but to have to wait an hour or more is RIDICULOUS!! However, we will give them one more try since the food was so delicious! (I wanted to write this review on Open Table, but since Luciano's cancelled our reservation after we left, I cannot.)

i6JbRgdJrUrrpXIod3rSnQ.text: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at Luciano's! It was our anniversary and we decided to try something new. We were immediately greeted by our waiter Alberto and treated very kindly. Alberto didn't hound us but was very honest and attentive. We ordered the flatbread pepperoni pizza which was DELICIOUS!!! We also had the Caesar salad, rigatoni, and the carbonara pasta-everything was outstanding. Since it was our anniversary they gave us a complimentary dessert and it was sublime. The manager even came by and boxed our food. We will definitely be back to this wonderful restaurant. Thank you Lucianos for making our anniversary special.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Strawberry Shortcake...YUM!!!

_Su19Sdgn4epK4k4MlURuQ.text: This place is amazing! I gave it 5 stars because it was a beautiful restaurant, casual, but classy, great service and best of all the food was delicious... as in over the top delicious! We just happened upon it and it already had good yelp reviews, but I think it deserves 5 stars. I would definitely recommend any of the pasta's and the shrimp appetizer was beautifully presented and was mouthwatering good!  I would definitely eat here again if I was in the area, unfortunately,  we were traveling and just stumbled across this gem of a place, thanks to Yelp.

ks1Rw6pdsh7_9jBVeArbiA.text: Quiet night but food and wine were excellent!! Had the calamari which was average.  Waitress was outstanding helping us throughput the meal and switching me from the Barbara to the Barolo a 2011 G.D. Vajra Barolo that was excellent !  The ravioli, short stuffed was very good and The Cannoli was very good.

TEDdBrs2qPjWqoH3eGWKQA.text: I really liked this place a lot!  First of all, they have parking!  I'm always nervous when I'm near the city because there's a lot of restaurants where you have to find your own parking, which annoys me.  They have a garage and it's free parking which is great!  I looked at some of the yelp photos before deciding to come here.  I'm a bread lover and I had never seen an Italian restaurant have tomato sauce as their dip, so it almost convinced me to go to the other Italian restaurant that I was considering, and I'm so glad I didn't.  The staff was really great here, extremely friendly and the environment was just as great.  They were great at giving recommendations for food and drinks.  I went on a Wednesday and found out that it was half off bottles night which was very exciting because we wanted a nice bottle of wine.  They brought out the bread and sauce which was soooo good!  It wasn't basic marinara sauce, it was like a great dipping sauce for bread which I didn't expect just looking at it.  She even offered us more bread (I would have asked anyway) which I love when they offer it.  I got the shrimp spaghetti dish which was absolutely amazing.  It was a little spicy but even if you don't like spicy, it wasn't overpowering.  In the end she re-corked our wine for us, which I have never had that offered before, so it was really cool since we couldn't finish it all.  Overall everything was amazing and I can't wait to go back!

BYZGxQE6RNVQ8nIud-KD8A.text: Ok, this is our 5th time back. Wow... always terrific. he food and service was terrific. The caesar salad actually had anchovies. My wife and guests were all so pleased.  Makes it worthwhile to leave Ballantyne

0Myca7tIst3uHYv2bMDAIQ.text: I saw the "Now Open" sign and decided to test this place out with a group of 6 girls.  The atmosphere is great; I love the decor.  It is very bright and open.  The food was delicious; I couldn't believe how fresh the mozzarella was in the caprese salad, and my Gorgonzola crusted steak was cooked perfectly.    What really impressed me was the manager.  A lot of managers at restaurants sit in the back  and watch everyone else work, but the one here is very hands on!  He came over and took our drink order when our server was busy, was busing tables, checking on everyone, and seemed to really care about and take pride in us enjoying the experience.    I will definitely be back!

FBLhGL4UNY9FaCRaU3VbFg.text: We went here with my 2 yr daughter. we loved the food and service.

w7LT7aWth7fw2gzSIGSK1Q.text: Food was great!! Service was horrible!! We were here for a friends birthday and our checks kept coming back wrong every time. Waiter was rude and we spent a ton of money on food and alcohol! So rude and I won't come back because of service.

_IaTfPeC6vO42stxyMbjPQ.text: My new favorite place for Italian when I am uptown or in Dilworth area.  A wonderful addition to this area.  Space much improved for dark and dreary LaPaz caveman space.  From the moment we walked into the new bright, expansive restaurant, we were treated like we were the only patrons there, even though there was a large party of 10 - 12 rigth beside us, our service never waivered.   Our server, Adela, was great - even recommending we share a plate since the portions are quite large.    We opted for a chopped salad with a mild Italian dressing, variety of lettuce crisp with fresh garbonzo  beans and a wedge salad with their house dressing which is similar to ranch.  Both were brought out in chilled plates - huge plus in my book.  It is the little things that were done throughout the evening that made for such an enjoyable dinner.  We noted to Adela that we were not in any hurry and she paced the delivery of the entree accordingly.  We paired the Coco Lasagna (crazy lasagna) with a nice, slightly chilled Italian wine.  I love it when a restaurant serves the red wine at the appropriate temperature - not room temperature at 72 to 74 degrees but more 66 to 68.  It so improves the wine experience.    Getting back to the lasagna - kitchen split the dish before serving to us and HELLO no splitting charge which I have yet to figure out why any establishment would do this.  Same quantity of food, only takes 2 seconds to split and plate on two plates instead of one and they charge for this?  Hubby (aka Bulldawg) loved his lasagna but loves his garlic too and thought maybe dish could have had a little more garlic.  Enter Alexander, stage right.  He asked Bully about his food and he didn't hold back on his need for speed - I mean garlic - next thing we knew Bully's dish disappeared and reappeared a few minutes later with an improved bolognese sauce with Bully's drug of choice - garlic.  We could not get enough of this sauce. I actually thought the second dish they brought to the table was another full portion which was great , totally unexpected and added with my leftovers, we will have another full meal.    This place is a date night, girls nite out, hiding out from the in-laws and pretending you are in Italy kind of place.    Loved every minute we were there and oh yes, free valet parking.  This places does it right!

6swpLepy1IP4oBu0OCIn0Q.text: Oh my how we love Luciano's!!  Absolutely no other restaurant in Charlotte can hold a candle to their Carpaccio appetizer or their sundried tomato dipping sauce.  Have mercy!  Their pastas are homemade, and you can tell.  Try the scallops and artichoke hearts over pasta appetizer. or if you're like me, ask for that dish in an entree sized portion.  We love the atmosphere as well - sophisticated but comfortable, and we've always found their wait staff to be solid and accommodating.  It is undoubtedly our favorite Italian restaurant in Charlotte - we always recommend it to both locals and visitors alike.

FjfCmlw2Rh5UahfZ2uhP-A.text: The service and ambience were great, however the food not so much. I ordered the Chicken Marsala and the portion was extremely small, chicken was not seared very well and the sauce had no flavor.

GsKcnewNL4l2rtckjWSNeQ.text: This place is awesome. Beautiful atmosphere and great service.. The food is simple and delicious..

sRs1T2xYQ2arNQVeeXD6Pw.text: The beef carpaccio is out of this world. It literally melts in your mouth, no chewing required. I'm a huge fan of carpaccio and Luciano's serves the best I've ever tasted. The salads are great as well. I'm a big fan of the mussels as they are flavorful, succulent and cooked to perfection. Management is superb, having no problems ensuring customer satisfaction. The only con, the Margarita Pizza. Mine didn't have fresh Mozzarella only shredded processed cheese, tomato sauce and a couple basil sprigs. Probably the WORST version of a Margarita Pizza I've ever had. However who cares the menu is full of other delicious options.

Dbm99edD9BH4LNirN1vskA.text: Excellent food. The atmosphere was great but I felt really under dressed when I first walked in. I felt better when I noticed they were showing football and there were people wearing jerseys and whatnot. The food was amazing especially the bread which I'm almost positive they bake in their brick oven. The service was also incredible - our glasses were never empty and as soon as our food hit the table there was a server right there to offer is fresh grated parmesan or black pepper. I was only in town for 1 night for a concert in Charlotte but would definitely come back if I happen to be in the area!

3foKZhhg0SHUSnSVE3LJQQ.text: Stop and think before you waste your time at any other Italian spot in Charlotte, this is it from the decor to the food and service. Had the potato and chive flat bread to start, bottle of fiano which the server recommended (spot on), followed by the chopped salad (no dressing needed), and finished with the coffee panna cotta (to die for)!

WnNKfK3u-tiVUOKUuLChBQ.text: We were in town for Turkey weekend, which means we needed a restaurant that could hold a crowd.  We came here for dinner on Saturday night with a total of 11 of us, including 2 very well behaved children (not even being sarcastic - it's just True).  We had a great time, and the restaurant itself was lovely!  It's very bright and even though it's loud, it's not deafening.  Everything everyone had was really good.  My hubby and I shared a wedge salad, but there were also a couple of Caesar salads and chopped salads at the table along with the soup of the day.  Our salad was super crisp and really good!  The Caesar salad was also delicious from the bite I tried!  For mains, I had the linguine carbonara and my hubs had the prosciutto pizza, and we split the two.  Both were really good!  The carbonara was a little creamier than I usually like, but it was seriously still so good!  For dessert I shared the brownie with my nephew.  FYI for anyone on a diet, you should always share dessert with a 6 year growing boy!  I seriously only got a couple bites in before he had ate it all, but it was also really good from what I tasted!   I would definitely come back here again next time I'm in town.

kYBrYZ_QZKyAcE1k-oPPaw.text: Just Awesome.  Every bite of food was awesome.  Ronald, out waiter even went to the kitchen and had them make me sauteed  brussel sprouts not on the menu.  We had the bone-in Ribeye Special of the day.  Dessert was equally fantastic!!!  Berry tart, the best I've ever had, my spoon was in it before it hit the table!

2rrxVElHpebgyRv8dPg25g.text: We went here as a large Group(Italian Club of Charlotte)...I believe there were almost 30 of us and they were ready for us...all on a Wed. evening when their wines by the bottle were 1/2 Price...let me say that again, WINES BY THE BOTTLE ARE 1/2 PRICE ON WEDNESDAYS'....all of us were mostly Italian so...when I say the place was really good...you are getting that from an Italian...everything flowed as you would want w/a big group and so to me; that is telling of how dinner would be if you were a table of 2 or 4...we did put in reservations almost 3 weeks in advance and confirmed 3 days before, the restaurant also confirmed w/us a day before(so doing big parties is no big deal for them)...I would tell you what to get from 1 dish to the next but-I don't need to do that...what I can tell you is whatever your in the mood for, as long as its Italian...go try Luciano's..you wont be disappointed. Ciao & Cheers!

S461K7ZupE7STXXdUp5Mzg.text: I ate at Luciano's with 13 of my favorite coworkers for a birthday lunch. Customer service was amazing, and they got our checks right on the first try (something that seems to rarely happen when eating out with a large group that is paying separately). I love the ambiance of the place and am interested in trying their dinner menu. My only complaint is the price, prices are a bit high for lunch (they seem more like dinner prices in my opinion)... the price will likely keep me from coming back too often, but I will definitely keep it in the dinner repertoire!

axxeJc8ijHedAe3bVG7Kyg.text: Very picky about Italian food. This place totally met my expectations, twice. Fantastic food and prices are worth it. Great service and the place is gorgeous. Wine pours are a bit on the small side. Friends fish dish was ok but my two pasta dishes were excellent.

8tf3ZQOc26au0SZCWWPUSw.text: A large group of us went for New Years Eve dinner. Luckily, we made reservations because they were slammed. We were greeted and sat immediately. The bread and sun dried tomato sauce was excellent! The whole table raved. They had a lovely NYE menu, but most of us ordered off the normal menu. I got the lasagne, which was amazing, with a wedge salad. The boyfriend got gnocchi. It was very rich, so the portion wasn't as big, but it was AMAZING. Eggplant parm, chicken parm, lamb chops, roasted chicken, and chicken piccata --all thumbs up from our group. The server was pleasant and helpful. All of our orders were correct and there were no glitches with appetizers coming before salads or not coming at all. A great band was playing, soft appropriate dinner music. We all LOVED this place and will definitely be back. Better pull out my fat jeans because this place is a new favorite.

XhJgcIwcxdaONgC6jbGQVQ.text: We came with the family to celebrate our anniversary (parents, kids and grandparents)..the place itself is very nice and I like the open tables and long tables for groups.  Our biggest complaint with the place is our server.  We were quickly seated and our waiter introduced himself and asked for the drink order..he took the hubby's and the kids, my parents and I were still deciding and he said he would be back.  He came back after a little while and asked if we were ready to order. He took our appetizer order and then left.. He didn't ask for our drink order.  He came back again and asked if we were ready to order..again not asking for our drink order. We were feeling rushed to order our dinner, even though the place wasn't crowded.  I finally said - you haven't even taken our drink order. "Oh, I didn't know you wanted anything"...If he thought we weren't drinking, maybe that's why for every dish we asked about he suggested adding something to it.  My husband asked how was the ravioli, he said " it's light meal and I would suggest adding chicken to it".. My husband said, "we are Italian and don't put chicken on ravioli.  Never in my life have I heard that suggestion".  We had a good meal but the service left a bad taste in our mouth.  We will try it again, but will request a different waiter.  Update:  We received a call from Luciano management apologizing for the waiters behavior and informing us that he had been let go.  They must have had complaints before. They sent us a gift card to come back and try them again.  We liked the food so we will be back to try it again.

WLZOr3Rm-3vqpNf13rDhoA.text: Luciano's is a great restaurant!  In the past weeks we've been twice. My husband had a very successful business party which was catered to perfection.  Then we went with a group of friends and had a fantastic dinner.  Their menu is varied, as is their wine.  Their Barolo was outstanding!   I hear the do brunch, that might be my next visit!

nUAHsxAMHnB2EtlwiwMYLQ.text: We are irregular regulars at this local neighborhood eatery. The food is always satisfactory to good, sometimes exceptional. We tend to drop in and sit at the bar, buy a bottle of wine and share a meal. Sometimes we invite friends and bring anywhere from 2 to 12 people with us. Last night we stopped in and seated ourselves at the bar on 1/2 price wine night. We ordered a $27.50 at half price bottle of wine, one eggplant appetizer, one primavera risotto with 4 shrimp entree, one slice of cheesecake. When we were ready to pay, our bill for sharing an average meal with half price wine was $100.00. This seems extreme to us for what we were served. When we left, we looked at our bill again, and saw we were charged $34.00 for shrimp primavera with 4 shrimp on it. The bartender who knows us might have seen it necessary to let us know the price of this meal. Needless to say, we will not be returning to Luciano's. We can head out on a week night in our neighborhood and find wine and a shared dinner for half that price. Thank you but no thank you.

bVpt7Q272ezp7rrTskcMew.text: I went to eat at Luciano's on Wednesday with my girlfriend and it was the best experience I have had in a while. The waitstaff was on point, great recommendation of wines from Cruz the bar tender. Genesis brought bread and water to our table was very friendly and polite each time she approached us. Really enjoyed that sundried tomato sauce. My girlfriend and I had the rigatoni salcicchia and the sea bass, which were magnificent and I look forward to going back.

LA2WeQPTKbodAmP3OrSoow.text: Great date night! The antipasto is fantastic and the homemade pastas are great.  The atmosphere is casual yet upscale.  Everything was delicious and authentic.

1FPwGfPhovHfNB_No4b2RQ.text: Love this restaurant. Delicious food and visually appealing. Only bad issue is parking. Extremely limited for the location. Too bad! :(

Rf5TUwxDCObqNPyqrIccBQ.text: I had a wonderful birthday dinner at Luciano's. It was my first time here and will definitely be back. Service was great, lovely wine selection, nice ambiance. We started with calamari which was very good and I had a pasta dish which was delicious and had enough for leftovers. They also brought me a complimentary dessert for my birthday, I chose tiramisu and i enjoyed it. One of the better dining experiences I've had since living in Charlotte

X0NIScIAoTjBg_TjXVnGtw.text: We dined there Saturday for restaurant week and everything was amazing. The portabella appetizer was super delicious, filet, chicken Luciano and seafood cannelloni were all cooked perfectly and scrumptious. Service was great! Not a single complaint!:)

vc_JBksYLZ8HqrJE8QlNPg.text: This place has it all. We were greeted and seated immediately on Saturday, 8/22/15. The ambience is great, so quiet and beautiful - like an italian restaurant should be. Service was fantastic. Staff answers questions and were right on the ball. Giving refills to drinks without us asking. Offering a stand for my purse so I didn't have to place it on the floor. Food was fantastic. Marinara sauce was the best I have had since moving to Charlotte in 2011 after living many years in NY and NJ. I highly recommend it - sorry I can not do five stars, nothing is perfect! But, this restaurant is close.

armddN0ImsayIijFry2i4w.text: No...just no. I was very disappointed in this place, especially since I read these reviews prior to going. Now my bf has Italian godparents that he lived with for almost 5 years so he knows real Italian cuisine. This was the farthest thing from that. I had the fettucini alfredo and wedge salad and my bf had the spaghetti and meatballs. It was worse than those Banquet or Marie Calendar frozen dinners. Yes, it was that bad. The "meatballs" were 80% breading or whatever and not much meat at all. The flavors of the sauces were basically nonexistent. It was just reallllly bad. I'm assuming their food doesn't travel well, but as terrible as it was I can't blame it all on the fact that it was take out. Should have just gone to Vapiano.

fXD2BK1bYNKGNOGq_oO6oA.text: Five for dinner last night and what a treat!  Everyone had a delicious meal and the service was outstanding!  This was our first experience at Luciano's and we were not disappointed.  Granted, Monday is not a busy night for restaurants, but we look forward to returning doing the fall theater season and expect the same treatment.  We were drawn to Luciano's with an advertisement in Clipper that displayed a scallop dinner that arrived identical to the photo for my wife that she thoroughly enjoyed.  My veal was crispy as I like it and the pasta made the meal perfect.  The antipasto was like we were in Italy, with melt in your mouth Prosciutto sliced paper thin.  Cannolis that make us want to leave from Rome tomorrow! We look forward to our return visit.

7xzKnRTZk-N2NvnOvaSjwA.text: great service. We were there on good Friday and the server made multiple suggestions for substitutions (at no cost) the accommodate a few no-meat eaters. Prompt and friendly service. Delicious food!

b-IkjriFbuFnXkRdN8pCSQ.text: I would rate the food as little better than Carrabba's, but not the best Italian food I've ever had. But not the worst either! Been consistently happy with my meals and had a pleasant dining experience. Affordable and nice ambiance. Good service.

EPQg-VqkIE2HmwCNpSQrnA.text: Went here for dinner for a friends Birthday last night with 10 other people. No one  at the table had the same thing and I didn't hear anyone with an issue! The service is very attentive and nice. I would recommend starting with the wedge salad before a pasta dish. I had the SHRIMP FRA DIAVOLO and it was amazing. Try the cheesecake for dessert! I will be returning for sure. Such a lovely evening.

2fbGKVFk1emqI2Wvn0Tr6A.text: Awesome time! Had a wonderful male server! It was a delightful evening celebrating my fathers birthday with a delish, quality meal. Great experience! Def. coming back!

M4CyEtkaQKJQngnZHgyk2w.text: Have been here a couple times and have always had a great 5 star experience. Regardless of what you order, the food is fresh and amazing. The complimentary sun dried tomato spread with bread is delicious. Their muscles in a white wine sauce I could seriously drink with a spoon (and did). We all ended up ordering the shrimp Shrimp Diavolo because it looked too good to pass up, and boy was it. The noodles tasted as authentic as ones I've had in Rome and the sauce had a nice heat to it without being over powering. Even the shrimp was perfectly cooked and didn't have a "fishy" taste in the slightest. Our waitress was very patient, we are question people, and knowledgeable. We also ended up sitting directly next to the owner and his friends and it was very neat to hear them having conversations in all Italian and copying what they ordered because we knew it would be great. Added bonus - Wednesday is half off wine!

gFoNC_TXARyCSW6QVLYyiw.text: Food and service were both great. We had crab cake starter which was meaty, the Orrecciette which was particularly good and then the chocolate cake and chocolate donuts with Nutella.

Q69rKH2pgIDyQxEqLwCJzQ.text: Rustic Bread and sun dried tomato dipping sauce was a first for me.   Gnocchi was baked and perfect.  Waiter was extremely helpful.   I'll be back.

NraPwga-PRiYu6aNAHkAvQ.text: Torn between 3 & 4 stars... truthfully the entire experience is more a 3.5 stars.  I have read mostly great reviews on this place, and finally decided to give it a try yesterday (Sunday) late lunch/brunch. I made a RSVP on OpenTable (not because it's needed, since it was 2:30pm and virtually empty) which rewarded 100 points (if that's your thing).   1st impression: nice interior, very romantic chic with the white on white & dark wood floors look.  We're sat immediately at a 4-top. Nice touch on the black napkin (all restaurants should use black napkins in my opinion). On Sundays they have the regular lunch menu and the brunch menu. My eyes went straight to the pan seared sea scallops with risotto ($16).  Waiter came and greeted us. While he was very efficient and did a good job in general, he's a little "rough on the edges" for this place. Example 1: I asked for water. He walked away and 3 steps later he turned around and loudly asked "you want lemon?" I don't need lemon for my water, but he could have easily brought over water and provide a small dish of lemon wedges if he wasn't sure. It beats yelling back at me 3 big steps away. Example 2: I inquired about the portion of the sea scallops. He didn't know. But instead of saying "I'm sorry ma'am, I don't know but let me find out" and actually go and find out, waiter looked at me and said "well, I don't know, I don't normally do brunch shift." And by "let me go find out," he meant walked 4 steps over toward the hostess station and loudly asked the waiter that's standing across the half wall. Eventually he walked to the kitchen. Well, why didn't he just do that to begin with?   Reality is the acoustics in this restaurant is amazingly loud. While there're only 2 other tables and a few patrons by the bar, it seems awfully ear piercing. I don't want to know how loud it can get when there's a full house.  My scallop dish came with 3 large sea scallops cooked perfectly in texture (as in a little rare in the middle) but I think the char on the cooking pan wasn't cleaned out first, because it had a slight burnt taste to it. The risotto tasted good but a little undercooked for my liking. But the portion was good, and it made great leftovers. For the price I think it's a great deal.  The pizza are $12 and was ok in size. Thin crust may be a better way to go ($11 instead) because the crust was a little on the doughy side.  All in all I think the place has good potential. The side dining room can make a great private dining area. The ambience was good if not a little on the loud side. I probably will stick with the lunch/brunch visit for value reason. I will definitely want to try the seafood soup next time.  Decor 4 Food 3.5 Service 3 Value 4 (for brunch/lunch)

y_bjwik70hweWead8-MlfA.text: I love Italian. And this was very good Italian....I was visiting Charlotte so I went for dinner. The Server was incredible. He was very attentive, knowledgeable, patient and full of good energy. He took my order, double checked on ingredients, and handled this dining experience with extra loving care. And even with a couple of food mishaps, he never missed a beat with service and a helpful attitude. I ordered the eggplant parma and it was flavorful and delish. My only issue, was the portion. I'm use to hearty portions at Italian spots so I had to order double the capellini pomodoro to get full. Overall, this one is a winner! Glad they have locations in Atlanta as well :)

Pxp2ePA8Qi3gv7LXLqnyXw.text: I was asked to meet someone here for a first date. This place was perfect for a first date. It was so romantic. The entertainment was great. The food was wonderful and the service was great. This has been added to the list as one of my favorites.

__fPBd4-dZfha_JwxRjQww.text: We (my wife, daughter and son-in-law) went to Luciano on the Sunday of Memorial Day weekend. Arrived just before 1:00. We were the only table occupied. Uh-oh! But it turned out that the food was delicious and the service was perfect. The waiter asked a couple of times if the shrimp far diovolo would. be too spicy. Turned out it was flavoral spicey but not hot spicey - just wonderful. My daughter ordered the chicken picatta and it was great. A really great experience.

QRZypUBd93RIXxbAeeJHfg.text: My brother and his wife took me here for driving them to the Charlotte Airport.  Paul was our waiter and did a great job. The food was phenomenal, some if the best Italian I have ever eaten. I had the chicken special over homemade basil pasta. My brother had fish that they deboned table side.  Great restaurant, great staff, great food.  Highly recommend.  I found them on yelp and hope you try them too.

hzOn17C5Vl4WT-NRZMrmTQ.text: Everything we had today was super tasty except for our entrees. We had 3 appetizers: crab cakes (wooooaahhhhh...yes yes yes), calamari (fresh and crispy), and mussels (plentiful). Our entrees were not so great however. My boyfriend had the linguine carbonara with blackened chicken. The best part was the chicken in my opinion but nothing to rave about... Especially after reading the other reviews. I ordered the ravioli al forno stuffed with mushrooms and baked in an Alfredo sauce. I ate half and the rest is currently on it's way to my trash can. The middle was cooked perfectly. however, when you get to the outside, it was a little too tough for my liking. Also, I expected a better Alfredo or recommend creating a better sauce for the ravioli....  The desserts though... HOLY COW!!! Dulce de Leche cheesecake and wild berry pan Chetta. They were sooooooo delicious and the best part of the evening. Please please please try these desserts. It'll ruin your life and overwhelm your palate with delicious joy!  Wait staff was great too though

jTzofjyiEltdAYMuJEE0VQ.text: My wife and I went to Luciano's this past weekend for a belated birthday dinner.  I'd never been, but she had on a work outing a while back.  I started with a Goose Island IPA and she got the red sangria.  Bread and a small dish of a tomato spread were promptly delivered to our table.  The bread was warm and crusty and the tomato was bright and flavorful.  We got white wine mussels as our appetizer.  The mussels were tasty but as everyone knows, you don't get the mussels for the mussels.  We got some extra bread to dip into the white wine sauce they came in.  It was absolutely delicious.  At first I thought it was a bit too heavy on the lemon but after my third piece of bread soaked in the stuff, I realized it was necessary to cut the richness of it and it would have tasted a bit too heavy without it.  Both of us got a caesar salad before our mains.  The homemade garlic croutons were excellent.  The dressing coated every piece of lettuce evenly and the shavings of parm on top were perfect.  I also really enjoyed the very coarse grind of the fresh black pepper offered by our server, Omar.  For my entree I got the braised beef agnolotti.  It is one of the best things I've eaten at a restaurant in years.  It came with brown butter, fried sage, and parmiagiano shavings.  The meat inside each one was soft, supple, and delicious.  With this entree you only get five or six agnolotti, so there won't be any leftovers, but it's so rich that you don't need any more than that.  My wife got the chicken fra diavolo.  I was quite impressed at how tender the chicken was, as breast meat can be woefully overcooked in dishes like that.  The herbal complexity of the sauce was also impressive, and the pasta was perfectly al dente.  After all of this we were stuffed but hey, it's my birthday, right?  We got our desserts to go.  I saw a table of bluehairs order the cannoli and it looked so good I had to have it.  My wife got the tiramisu.  Even coming out of the fridge a couple hours later, both of them were excellent.  Service was pretty good, and ambiance was fine.  The food was the absolute star of the show here, and we will certainly be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Braised beef agnolotti at Luciano&#39;s

mh7qpIweXkb6z7s-6UpY7Q.text: Usually I love the fettuccini Alfredo and carbonara sauce!   This time the carbonara on pasta which they ended up making twice. Still not very good. I settled for some plane pasta with butter and cheese so I wouldn't be hungry.   They make good drinks. Gin a tonic and vodka tonic.   Creme Brulee - Worst I've ever had. The top wasn't crunchy. The inside was grainy. Cold, old, & yucky!!   Usually everything is amazing, so I will probably try them again.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our wine selection - nicely chilled outside
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gin a tonic - very good
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Side of moz

oyKQ9KvuU5AbFYxI3mVeHw.text: 3.5 stars   My boyfriend and I returned to Luciano's for Restaurant Week as our second try. We were seated in the extension area, not the actual main room, despite our reservations. Our server Phillip was nice but not spectacular, I wish he actually brought the bread that he said he would bring back, the comp bread and marinara app was very tasty and fresh. I felt pretty neglected after our appetizers were brought up.  Drinks:  Strawberry Basil- I didn't like this at all, I even struggled to finish it. It was a bit too bland and bubbly for me.   App:  Antipasto Salad: the bf loved this! The balsamic vinaigrette was so on point. It had a little too many olives for my unconditional liking.  Peppers Alla Romana: Very good! Though stuffed with goat cheese, the chorizo and arrabiata sauce toned it down to a great balance. I could have munched on these all night. This was my second favorite dish of the night.   Entree:  Linguini Pescatore: I loved the fact that so much seafood was included in the actual dish and not just on the menu. It was generously garnished with yummy shrimp, clams, oysters, and mini scallops. I'm usually not a fan of white wine sauce, but I did enjoy this dish. I wasn't as overpowering as I expected it to be. However, I do think that the pasta noodles were waaaay overcooked.  Chicken Capricciosa: It was a little dry, I think a little arrabiata sauce would perfect this dish. The lemon risotto was so creamy, I could have eaten a whole bowl. The tomato arugalla salad was delicous and paired well with the Romano encrusted chicken. This was also a very large dish, we came back with left overs.   Dessert:  Banana Bread Pudding: OMG, put the twinkie down and head to Luciano's for this! We loved this! The bread pudding itself was not overly sweet but the caramelized bananas were delicious with the salted caramel. The bf and I have agreed that we would return just to order this. OUR FAVORITE DISH OF THE NIGHT.  Chocolate Mousse Cannoli: also very good. I've never had a cannoli but, Luciano's does it right. It was very fresh and light.   We did enjoy the food here, we will be back. Shout out to Miguel the GM for bringing me back, I appreciated the effort you put in to Luciano's, it has clearly paid off.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Banana Bread Pudding, YUMMM.
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate Mousse Cannoli
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Capricciosa

Ch-GeF2H59_dBx_5isvcng.text: For the money, this is the best Italian place in Charlotte that I've been to.  I wouldn't go as far to to say that every dish is outstanding because this is my 3rd or 4th time here and I've had a different Dish each time.  I will rank the the 3 dishes I can remember in order from best to least favorite below:  1.  Chicken Picatta (not sure about the spelling here but this dish is magnificent, the chicken has an amazing creamy taste with the capers contributing to savory finish.  At first I thought the pasta was a little underdone but they serve all pastas al dente, which is traditionally the way it should be prepared.  I grew to appreciate this and I think I will stick with this dish on future visits.)  2.  Spaghetti and Pork Meatballs ( This is not your average spaghetti and meatball dish.  For one thing the meatballs are huge and better than any I've ever had.  The sauce was also a delightful blend of tasty herbs and vegetables which was very tasty beyond anything you could prepare yourself or buy at the store.)  3.  Chicken Fra Diavolo- ( Though this was my least favorite dish it wasn't because the sauce and spices were not delicious.  It was because the chicken in the dish was flavorless and this was very disappointing.)  One last closing remark would be to ABSOLUTELY GET THE CARPACCIO as an appetizer because it the best thing on this entire menu.  It comes out on an enormous plate and for $13 you cannot beat this deal.  I can't even explain it you'll just have to go and taste how good this is in person as any explanation just wouldn't do it justice.  I will be return.

f20DU6jJZrGwxQ8x0mtFeg.text: It was a stretch to give 2 stars.  We got reservations for a late Saturday night meal and the place was packed.  Having eaten in the Atlanta Luciano's my expectations were pretty high.  Except for having the same ownership, these 2 restaurants unfortunately are quite different.  Our server was initially very quick to our table, almost as soon as we were seated.  With a larger group, it takes a bit of time to digest the menu and wine list.  And then we waited.  Eventually she showed back up and took our orders.  And then we waited.  About 20 minutes later, wine glasses show up.  But they are not all the same, one glass is for Pinot and the rest are normal Cabernet.  Very odd for an upscale restaurant, I even asked about it when we noticed it.  Was told there were no other clean glasses (and that's after waiting about 20 minutes?).  Another 10 minute wait before our wine shows up.  So we've been here close to a hour already and finally just getting wine.  And then we wait.  OK, so I'm grumpy again (granddaughter in tow) and finally food comes out.  With the bread for the table.  We eat, and then wait.  Only 1 time after receiving the food did anyone come by to see if we needed anything.  We're sitting there, finished, and waiting on our check.  Our server is no where to be found.  Our table is cleared, still no waitress.  Finally our check arrives (well over 2 hours since we arrived!) and you can imagine my disgust to see that a 20% tip was applied to the bill.  I said we were a large group.  5 adults and a 2 year old.  Six people.  20%.  20% on top of wine AND tax.  I'm not one of those to stiff the staff, but I did hand write on the check that the tip was not earned or deserved.  Just be informed.

gZC5MmGg5PHC_S1IrZjnyQ.text: I've been waiting to try Luciano's and finally got the chance for a friend's birthday dinner. And it was well worth the wait!   There were about 14 of us in the party so we were seated in the private dining area and that worked out so well! We were able to enjoy the evening and feel like we basically had the place to ourselves!   Our waiter was Fernando and he was awesome! He was supper attentive and we always had what we needed and that's no easy task when you have 14 starving ladies! We started off with some sangrias and the bread with marinara. Those sangrias definitely packed a punch. Don't think of your typical sangria mix....kick it up a few notches and you have the Luciano's version. So good!   To start, I ordered the Wedge salad which come topped with tomatoes, bacon, parmigiano dressing, and gorgonzola cheese. It's a classic,  not overdone or too fancy. Add to that the dressing was perfect! I'd definitely recommend. For  my dinner I ordered the Shrimp Fra Diavolo. My goodness. The large shrimp were perfectly cooked and the marinara and brandy combination was so flavorful!   So glad I had the opportunity to give this place a try. The service and food were both excellent and I look forward to my next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Fra Diavolo

YJCyHxr5uZ9PVD866QvMyw.text: You know those places that use really big plates for presentation? The atmosphere was good with plenty of room between tables. The menu variety was good. The service was below expectations. I ordered a plate and I was expecting a "wedge" but it was half an ice berg head of lettuce. I returned it. The waitress didn't seem to care nor did the manager. The main plate was good but the service seemed to go downhill. Oh and I would make it $$$

j4dsTOV3dQ9l38wRNuJ0vg.text: Not cooked and about as basic as you can get. Had it before but tonight was terrible. I've never seen a wood fire pizza look like it just came out of a grocery frozen pie.  Very disappointing and I'm not one to complain

KES0zdqIHWiPrR9tkKcrWw.text: We stopped in for dinner during a short visit to Charlotte based on the Yelp reviews. The atmosphere is comfortable, the service is great and the menu has lots of enticing options.   The bread was good and the sundried tomato sauce was tasty.  Our table's orders included Chicken Parm and a pizza. The chicken was good but the sauce was a bit sweet and the capallini overcooked. I didn't try the pizza but it looked ok.  The prices were reasonable and we enjoyed the experience (though I don't see the value in a gas fueled pizza oven beyond its appearance).

InL1vM35CkRxGB0YHNOdAg.text: Our first visit and it was amazing. Waitstaff was friendly and attentive.  Food was authentic Italian cooked to perfection. Our special requests were met with a smile. Madeline was was exceptional. Truly 5 stars.

DQIWuSxmtDrN7BHORrBN0Q.text: Great wine list. Dinner salads: house and Caesar excellent. Spaghetti with veal meatballs very good. The best meatball ever. Lasagna ok. The menu is excellent. We were just in the mood for red sauce. Great service and great atmosphere.

zv2mqdNRAa8Lz0n3TuX4Uw.text: Date night. Awesome little restaurant with great food and friendly service. All the food was very fresh and server was very attentive to our needs. This place is a must try. Come hungry and leave full.

-qr4gzyxa-pkIOsfKGb4rw.text: I haven't experienced the Italian in Charlotte but Lucianos has to be authentic. The food was amazing. Starti g with the bread that comes out first, nice and warm. The food... AMAZING. great flavor and taste!. I'm a vegetarians I was skeptical about the options but they had something for me, thank God! .. The pasta primavera was great! Glad that I was able to choose my pasta.

PIG8a5UjHGNkUTvOTERrvA.text: Heard nothing but great things about Luciano's, so decided to try it out while in South End one evening. Place is beautiful, so cozy. Perfect for a date night or group dinner. Ronald took great care of us throughout the evening.   They have a sun-dried tomato dipping sauce for the bread. Different and I like it. Started with a bottle of wine and the calamari. We pretty much always get calamari at an Italian restaurant. Theirs is mixed with fried zucchini. Mmm. I love nothing more than taking a healthy green vegetable and deep frying it.   I declined on a salad because I knew we had a lot of food coming, but I kept sneaking bites of my boyfriend's wedge salad. It was so refreshing. I am not a blue cheese person but the dressing was pretty subtle.   I opted for one of the specials- crab and lobster ravioli. It had a tomato cream sauce and was topped with cherry tomatoes and kale. Sauce was a little salty but I loved the kale topping. Really helped balance out the tastes and textures. I would probably stick to the menu offerings next time, ended up being a pricey entree (no surprise as its crab and lobster). Boyfriend got the gnocchi and O.M.G.  Don't think we will will be able to skip this when we come back. Delicious.   Their desserts all looked great, but we were way too stuffed for that. So many other things on the menu I want to go back and try. Plus, 10% off food for checking in with the Yelp app. Love that.
