Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gnocchi
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lobster and crab ravioli

P_cs9kNzHYrJtqNoQ0mHOA.text: I am surprised i had not made it to this place earlier.  Very glad I found it, again, thanks to you Yelpers.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. They welcome you with bread and this yummy sauce
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese appetizer

ww7DRURsaiqkablpw1IVZQ.text: I have had some mixed experiences at Luciano. It seems that the wait staff is more on point during busier times, and lacking on slow nights.  This lack of consistency brought my rating down.   Otherwise, the space is really nice - has a high-end, modern feel to it. They also offer valet parking, which is nice on busy nights in South End. Its not a huge restaurant, so reservations are recommended. This is a nice spot for celebrations.

Pj68S735jBVT--mNXm9w1g.text: I ate here two nights in a row. My husband recommended it and I was not disappointed. The food was very good. The ambience...somewhere between sophisticated and a sports bar. I am not sure which they prefer to be but there seemed to be a comfortable spot for fancy celebrations and casual get togethers, simultaneously. Four stars because the service staff needs some training. One night we didn't have enough; the next night we had too much and he was practically pushing us out the door.

pO8-fqMqILr0PIH8XTfkBw.text: The food is incredible and ambiance is exactly what you look for when planning a date night or special event.  I crave their lasagna dish and always have left overs for lunch, so portions are huge.  We highly recommend Luciano's!

S3YiEtvnuoZBVDj2OEX7Ag.text: Incredible food, atmosphere and staff went beyond what I could expect to ensure our night was one to remember. I certainly would go to this restaurant again and recommend it to others to enjoy! ,

eqq5Dm7mSP02Oiv9rVVJQQ.text: I tried out Luciano's thanks to Queen's Feast aka a food lover's favorite time of the year! Reservations were made so it made dining on a Saturday evening a breeze.  We were greeted and immediately seated in the room off of the main dining room. The main dining area is very nice, all black & white decor. Our table of fabulous ladies started off dinner properly with glasses of wine.   To note, if you order a glass of red wine, the wine will be poured into a comically oversized wine glass. My glass of sauvignon blanc appeared in an adequately sized glass.  For appetizer, I ordered the fried zucchini. Forgive me, because I forget the actual Italian name for it. They were delicious!! Thin zucchini patties served with arugula and a side of marinara sauce for dipping. Main entree, I ordered the seafood cannelloni. I wasn't as happy with this dish. It tasted a little too shrimp-y for me. Dessert, I got the chocolate cannoli. It was good but nothing special.  I found the portions to be just right and the meals were spaced out with just enough time in between. A lot of the time with restaurant week menus, the wait staff seems to rush to bring out the dishes with you not being able to fully enjoy each plate. Not at Luciano's, I got to enjoy and eat every bite of my meals.  I was very pleased with my experience and look forward to going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. chocolate cannoli
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. seafood cannelloni
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. lightly fried zucchini with arugula and marinara sauce

B9O5_OTq9qP0ToGPN7OP7w.text: Wow! We had a small flight delay and needed to eat before going to airport. Found this place on a google search! Told the hostess we only had about a half hour to eat. She said no problem. We quickly ordered and miraculously our food came less than 10 minutes later and was piping hot and delicious. Spaghetti and meatballs, gnocchi and rigatoni salsiccia were on point! Our waiter even refilled our drinks before we had to ask! Great food, great staff!

WQ6GWQ6tzoVvYumJt_vkHw.text: Been here a few times and very much love the customer service and ambiance.  however, on my recent visit I ordered something that was "seasonal" on their menu.  It was watermelon salad, with heirloom tomatoes and feta (which I was able to switch out for Gorgonzola).  I'd like to recommend to the chef and manager at not only this restaurant but others, do not have fruit and vegetables on the menu when they are not in season.  Clearly its not watermelon season at the end of February and beginning of March, because the watermelon was totally tasteless and sour.  Also, I don't know what heirloom tomatoes taste like but I do know what Roma tomatoes taste like and those were totally Roma.  I did enjoy my Martini and the company I had. Great outdoor seating and indoor decor.

_ouu0yQH7vnpDdDYwFkNQA.text: We had a wonderful, romantic dinner at Luciano's! The decor and atmosphere was elegant and cozy. The wait staff was great and our food was mouthwatering. Very authentic Italian food expertly made. We had the chicken Parmesan and chicken fettuccini. Every detail was seen to as we enjoyed our meal in the beautifully decorated restaurant. It was a perfect date night for us!!

-Y0qCylOfyBcaXKrLJFN_A.text: Wonderful restaurant. Beautiful interior design, very elegant Italian upscale features including imprinted tin ceilings, luxurious crown molding, beautiful piers and stanchions make you feel as if you on a lovely vacation. The detail work is amazingly intricate.  Our waiter Roy is an engaging, friendly perfectionist who always seemed to appear when you thought you might need anything. He was knowledgeable, informative and interested in meeting all of our needs. He introduced some of the restaurant's guest favorites - all yummy!  We had Greek salad, bean and sausage soup, meatballs, spaghetti and meatballs, chicken and spinach pizza, wine, peach bellini's, and tiramisu (sp.) dessert  Foodies - Please go and enjoy.  Regina Taylor-Hines

qx3K1yTS3-l6KfGa3yVryw.text: This restaurant reminds me of home, New York City! The decor, the great service and some really delicious food! Cannot wait to return. For us there is  no other Italian restaurant in the Charlotte area. From the salad to the desert....absolutely great food.

HCe9AA9Vv46jcY9v1IKXkQ.text: Took my dad for his birthday and our party of 4 loved it. The food was prompt, hot, and delicious. The waiter made recommendations and was spot on. The drinks were creative and an extensive wine list. I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Italian sausage and peppers
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked chicken pizza

GTpjbJXPeljO2YhMxAeMvQ.text: I made reservations ahead of time.  Glad I did!  Even though there were three empty (dirty) tables when we arrived at 8:35, we were told to wait. We had a drink at the bar and looked over the menu.  15 minutes later, we were seated.  5 minutes go by, then someone comes by with water and tells us our waiter will be right with us. Guitar player and singer were very talented and a nice added touch!  Then we are given warm sourdough bread with a plate of sun dried tomatoes with olive oil.  Bitter and odd. In all of my years I have never been served anything but Italian bread in Italian restaurants. Bitter sun dried tomatoes with sourdough bread?!  Eventually the bartender comes over, tells us the specials, and takes our order.  Now we're up to 5 dirty tables around us.  Chopped salad comes out. Lettuce, red cabbage, garbanzo beans, vinegrette.  Very bitter and very little creativity.  Eggplant parmegian and chicken parmegian come out with sides of Angel hair pasta.  Large portions!  My chicken was good as was the eggplant.  Sauce on the pasta was also bitter.  Now we're up to 7 dirty tables surrounding us!    We ordered Nutella filled zeppoli for dessert with coffee.  Great ending as dessert was nice and the coffee was excellent.   Lack of busboys  and waitstaff was obvious.  Seven dirty tables at 9:30?!  Not one dish or glass removed the entire time we were there.  I never saw a manager the entire time.  Bill for 2 entrees, a side salad, 3 glasses of wine, dessert, and coffee totaled around $110 including tip.   Valet service was a needed touch as parking tends to be tough since they share a parking lot with another restaurant.  Overall, good food and atmosphere, but lack of service ruined our visit.  No hurry to go back.

JKbF9CUH1kU7QqBaZvjYMw.text: Had the pleasure of dining here for restaurant week. Party of three so I got to sample pretty much everything on the restaurant week menu. Everything was really good. I did feel like the potatoes needed more gorgonzola though. Parking was pretty hard. There was such a long line to pull in we had to go to the next street over to park. Very nice ambiance but it can get super loud inside.

IpMw6wjYkMr5Jjig_V_zvQ.text: This place is really fantastic for upscale Italian cuisine. The ambience is quite nice, and the food is delectable!  The only reason I can't give it 5 stars is because the service is only so so. The last time we went our waiter was a bit rude to my best friend, my fiance and I. I'm sorry, but don't be in t he service industry if you hate people! This guy was blatantly irritated with us from the moment he first greeted us.

JIl2VEtVqtqUfa0Ji1vK5Q.text: I keep wanting to find an exceptional Italian restaurant in Charlotte. I had hopes for this one when it was recommended to me by a friend. Unfortunately I was disappointed. The cappellini pasta was overcooked and broken into small pieces. The Bolognese sauce was billed as a specialty but I think is just mediocre. My husbands lasagna Bolognese was a better dish, but mostly because of all the cheese on it. The fresh bread was delicious and I enjoyed the dipping sauce for it.

dmH2DLRrEjh121EY-oOyXA.text: My husband and I went out here for a date night.  We had a fantastic night... great food,  great service, romantic atmosphere.  I definitely recommend it for a special night out. A bit pricy but absolutely worth the splurge.

XlMWavb-GvSMpEx5_J1N-Q.text: Absolutely wonderful, smiling service! The food was incredible and the atmosphere was perfect for our Christmas Eve dinner. My son ordered pepperoni pizza and said it was the best he's ever had. The carpaccio was also out of this world. Definitely coming back often!

Y4s8md5VwB0gdlqFCuL2nA.text: What an absolute delight!  Luciano's has it all.. Amazing food, impeccable service, ambience, and all at at affordable price.  What are you waiting for?  Get over there for lunch or dinner STAT!  I took my best friend here for her "bachelorette dinner", but it was just us and one other friend.  The three of us were each treated so well.  We're a lively group and always have something to say, so as we sat down, a waiter asked if "regular water" was ok for us.  We asked what would happen if it wasn't, and he grinned and said he could get us spritzer or something else, but that this was "fine regular water" so we said, well, that'll be ok.  After that, every time he came by, the water got better and better..  by the end of the evening it was "fine, refined, italian water specially prepared for our dining pleasure".  It was cute, but not crazy silly.  We laughed and talked with all our wait staff and everyone was just as friendly and nice.    So, I say all that to illustrate, the training program for this staff must be something very special.  I have rarely had such a fun AND professional dining experience.  The food, however, is the real star here.  Our table tried the Tortellini, the Gorgonzola Steak, and the Chicken Cacciatore.  Every single entree was sublime, the flavors perfectly balanced.  For dessert we shared Tiramisu and Cannolis.  On both dishes, I've never had better!  This restaurant is beautiful, has top notch staff and delicious food.  On Wednesdays they're now doing 1/2 priced bottles of wine, too.  Get by and check this place out.  If you want, tell them the "girls in the corsets" sent you.  ;)

Q18orDn122aImmiXx4ffyQ.text: Had the Duck two way for dinner ,it's a  very delicious and rich plate. The service is good and if you like people  watching get a table outside. Will come here again.

cT8EiT_zAnfazu_juPmk-A.text: We have recently moved to Charlotte and have been unable to find good food.  This was great food and such a nice environment. I have Celiac's and they accommodated my need for Gluten Free food without hesitation.  We went for lunch and I had the three course special, amazing and for a $14.95!!  My husband had egg plant Parmesan and said it was really good too.  We will be visiting often.

yl1-DGOPc3U7UR2ci9Xfnw.text: Our wait or Eric introduced himself as Jennifer. He was so funny and a pleasure to have at our table. We overheard all of his other tables laughing at his humor! Great guy.  I had the lasagna. If you like it dry and not saucy with a copious amount of cheese on top then you'll like this. It wasn't my favorite but I'm a particular eater and I could tell this was high quality, authentic cuisine, just not in my taste. Next time I will go for the flounder and spinach dish.  My husband loved the carpaccios and the baked goat cheese appetizers.  I wish I would have taken pictures because the presentation was gorgeous.  The staff was all excellent. I would recommend this place to a friend.

sGroWyH1oP4mJ8V6pqgJig.text: Hands down one of the best Italian experiences in Charlotte. The service here is exceptional and you can tell they really care about the food they are putting in front of you. We started with the complimentary bread and what tasted like a sun dried tomato like sauce, and also had the goat cheese pomodoro appetizer. That appetizer is a MUST if you come here, I could have made a meal out of it. I had the linguine carbonara, which may be the best carbonara I have ever had. It was so rich and flavorful, the bacon was cooked perfectly for the sauce and the peas and onions really finished the deal. The sauce was creamy and ugh I could go on and on. I took home a piece of the tiramisu and wow that was fantastic. I mean seriously good!!! This restaurant really knows what it's doing and I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fantastic Italian dinner in Charlotte!

jORFJDAC4npdRn7ozof-AQ.text: Check in, you may get 10% off. Great food!!! Not a cheap place. 2 cocktails, app, salads and entrees for 2 no dessert $100. Live music and great service, we will come back.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Live music

58VuN7p8HiVY31_T9iW5Gg.text: We ate here last night for the first time.  Food was really good, im not often impressed but I was here. The scallop and artichoke app was delishous.  My only complaint was our server, she didn't ruin our experience but she wasn't great.  Ordered a coke, never got it, asked for more bread, that didnt come unril we finished our meals but the one thing that lost the star was she never told us there were specials. I heard her tell the next table over after we ordered. Im a foodie so I like to know all my options and there was a special I definitely may have liked to try.  Regardless we will definitely be back.

Wuno7_Kd5ZoFpxwymOSpTQ.text: The service was top notch I have to say, and I really enjoyed my gnocchi! My boyfriend didn't care for his soup and they immediately asked if they could offer us a dessert to compensate. We ultimately had wonderful food and really appreciated how well we were treated. Will definitely be coming back!

-jkZSmWK6c_zA-BpCuEBqQ.text: Went to Lucciano's for the first time tonight and it was a consensus among my family that we don't need or want to go back. If I was rating just on service then I would give them 4 stars, but the food did not measure up! Definitely way overpriced and our whole table ended up with upset stomachs once we got home. On top of that there was an added gratuity just for a table of 4! I have been to plenty of restaurants where they add the gratuity for a party of 6+ but never for a family of 4.

d-TTvvwfyET51lBRDfmXcA.text: We came around 7:15 the Saturday before Mother's Day and we made a reservation. I was surprised with the time and occasion that it wasn't more busy than it was when we walked in, but as we were leaving, the place was packed. I guess they draw a later crowd.   I'll start with the service. Our waitress was very nice and outgoing, slightly forgetful though. Forgot bread, refills, a salad etc. Not a huge deal and her friendliness and her personality made up for it. I will say the wine, for $10 a glass was an under-pour. Obviously not the waitress's fault, just something worth noting.   We started with the antipasti plate and the baked goat cheese dish. Both were good, but for the price of the antipasti plate, it could use some more food and I'd recommend giving a few more pieces of the toasted ciabatta bread. I also had a wedge salad. Can't really go wrong with a wedge but the Parmesan dressing was tasty.   My entree was the gnocchi. This came in an Gorgonzola cream sauce with prosciutto and bread crumbs. Very tasty, not a huge portion though. I also added Italian sausage to this dish. I'd definitely recommend this, it worked well with the dish.   All in all, this restaurant was tasty with friendly service. A bit overpriced for what it is, however.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. The gnocchi. I added Italian sausage, a good decision.

EIbANd53euD8xA_eotrG8Q.text: There are only a few times when I can honestly leave a 5-star review.   I visited this restaurant for the first time to celebrate my birthday. Parking was a breeze- complimentary valet. We had reservations and didn't have to wait.  The bread and sauce provided were amazing. The drinks were very made, as well. I ordered the tomato basil fettuccini... delicious and the perfect serving! The sauce was creamy and complimented the dish so well. My partner ordered the chicken Parmesan. He finished it all and stated that the potion was generous and had no complaints. For dessert, I ordered the strawberry shortcake. It was what heaven must be like. The cake was light and sweet without tasting artificial or dense. It tasted better than a bakery.   Service was spot on and really made my day special. I can't wait to return!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tomato Basil Fettuccini with cheese added
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Parmesan
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Birthday strawberry shortcake

9F-rDlg-2MxqtdclmiLIJw.text: Food fantastic. We searched Yelp and Luciano's came up. Not only was the food terrific but the service made it a 10. Our server, Fernando, made it a memorable experience. We won't forget our trip to Charlotte, NC.

iZdoapzeth5pGPs5NniqlA.text: Food is great.  Service not so much.  And if you like staring at this while you eat -- dirty tables EVERYWHERE.  We had to bus our own table and were basically ignored.  Spoke to management who was useless.  Charlotte dining scene is getting better now so go elsewhere.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States

3ny7oZwTwDkXMcxofPGW_g.text: Fancy Italian in Southend, Luciano's is part of the Steel Yard and Sullivan's property at South Boulevard and Tremont Street. White table cloths and heavy cutlery and back & white waiters.  They do have a good, if limited, selection of Italian classics and then a few other dishes.  I opted for the capellini bolognaise and it was a good portion of a rich and meaty sauce, already tossed through. My wife opted for the lamb chops and she enjoyed them. Three good sized and meaty chops in a savory sauce with small potatoes.  Dessert was a chocolate torte that was excellent. Nicely plated and very sweet.  Valet parking available.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veal chops at Luciano&#39;s
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Capellini bolognaise
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chocolate dessert at Luciano&#39;s

g39aYsvrx2EjqDQIwovA8w.text: Came here on a Friday at 6:30. Made reservations although that was unnecessary. We got a wedge salad, goat cheese appetizer, zuppa do mare, and the seabass. Everything was good, service was good. Place was really slow when we got there but started filling up. A 2 person duo starting singing around 7. It was light and not disturbing. My Seabass was cooked perfectly, the only thing I would change is the way it was placed on top of everything. All the flavors were great but I don't like mixing my food when it sines to a $45 seabass. I want to taste everything separate. Can't believe I didn't take pictures. My favorite thing was the goat cheese app

KdKvJzV4K-XqDz2OxzJ9aw.text: Everything was Great! Loved the carry out bags! Wish their internet worked. I logged in but it didn't work. :-(

6KzMRCITE1HrJWex9N6NlQ.text: I ordered a pizza from Luciano's and it was horrible. Way overpriced for the size. I ordered a margherita pizza and it was literally a plain cheese pie with 4 basil leaves. And the crust was burnt. Definitely not ordering from here again. I regret not ordering Dominos instead.

2DOvvK4juhdTnNaaX0PeZQ.text: Such a pleasant date night experience!  We happened to show up for date night on half price wine night....SCORE!  They were able to recommend a great wine for us, and it complimented the dinner so well.   We began with the baked goat cheese pomodoro. The bread was delicious and the spicy sauce was the perfect compliment to the goat cheese. They also give you a nice helping of the goat cheese.  The restaurant also provides you with bread and dip, so this was just a nice addition.   We split two entrees recommended by one of the managers. We had the mushroom risotto with scallops and the lasagna coco pazzo or a "deconstructed lasagna." Both portions were very large and very delicious! I think we agreed that we both liked the lasagna better because it was different and the meat sauce was incredible. The scallops were cooked perfectly too though.   Lastly, we finished with Italian Ricotta cheesecake and Creme brulee. She warned us that the Italian Ricotta cheesecake would not be as sweet as a normal cheesecake, but we love ricotta so we went for it. We were very glad we did. It was unique and we enjoyed trying something new. The creme brulee was picture perfect as well. They bring the desserts out on a plate to show you before you order them, which was a nice touch.   The service and hospitality here was incredible. We were treated so well, and I was so grateful for this. Not only is it delicious, the people are so great! We will definitely, definitely be back. Kind people, delicious food, romantic, great location.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Creme brûlée
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Italian cheesecake with ricotta
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Deconstructed lasagna

HSm-H9BIm1-yXXzmJaHStQ.text: AMAZING food and service! Perfect place for a date night if you're looking for great food and friendly service.

xJSHv9eKa3uakzBsnsaGQw.text: Sunday brunch day and we landed here after church.  It was a SLOW start as it took about twenty minutes to be served something to drink.  NOT good, and the restaurant was not that busy. When the server finally came, I asked a question about the menu.  She didn't know the answer and said that she would find out. In the meantime, she went to get the orders from another BIG table of patrons. It took a lot of time to get the answer to my question. In fact, things were so obviously out of whack that I asked the hostess to please send the manager to talk with me.  When the manager came, she was eager to make things right.  She wanted to comp the bill, but that's not what I wanted. I just wanted efficient service. In the end, they took 50% off of the tab and the server apologized.  As far as the food:  the omelet that I got was tasty, but very small.  A few fork fulls and it was all gone.  I eat a lot of omelets and I know what constitutes a reasonable portion.  They served enough for an elf.  I probably should have gotten the blackened chicken salad that came with cranberries and gorgonzola and other good stuff, but I didn't. (Insert the idiom about HINDSIGHT).  I love the space in this restaurant. It makes me feel really comfortable.  There is an elegance about it.  I'd say with more efficient service and a slightly better portion size,  Lucianos could rock the world in a bigger way.  Just the opinion of one.

8v4iG9-wJZ-9pIAymK0YZg.text: If you are looking for great Italian food and a classy atmosphere Luciano's would be my recommendation. The prices are great for the quality of service and food that is offered at Luciano's. I had the Lobster ravioli special and it is definitely some of the best Italian I've eaten.   They also have half off wine sections on Wednesday!

jdTcuy8aKqTxn9F7IsiTHw.text: I came once on a Friday night and found the food and experience to be quite average. Service was inattentive (I had to flag down servers to get bread or the check), the beer glass was iced so much that there were icicles (I had to ask for another glass as my hand couldn't maintain a firm grip), and the pasta was nothing to rave about.   I did come one hour before closing so it's very possible I just caught them at a bad hour or night, but I do think there are better Italian restaurants within a 10 min drive so I wouldn't come back again.

g1jzwx_TRaL_jkxDQRa16w.text: We were traveling to Miami for Christmas and vacation and stopped for a night in Charlotte. We wanted authentic delicious Italian for our Christmas Eve dinner but ever place we called was closed. We landed on Luciano's and jumped on it simply because they were open. BUT we ended up having a meal we will ALWAYS remember. I ordered the Chicken Piccata. It was very good BUT my husband got the Scallop Artichoke Linguine Lemon Butter. I didnt finish mine because his was so much good and was OFF YHE CHARTS good. We finished it off with the best Tiramasu I've ever had (and I've had alot). Our server sounded Italian and he was so wonderful and made the experience even more authentic. The front desk manager and his team of hostess and servers were constantly helping to get folks seated, and although they were extremely busy, they were smiling and very nice. Wish I could make this my regular go-to place and wasnt just passing through.

syOrjODSjcgZs9DeJM7XXg.text: We had our meal delivered tonite.  Best Italian food we've ever had in NC! The chicken parmigiana and the pasta Bolognese was the best ever!  The grilled asparagus and fresh bread and oil made it a perfect meal.  We didn't get to the salad because we indulged ourselves in the pasta and chicken.  What a truly perfect meal!

WGxFeMFCKoFz5z4jp8Rujw.text: This place is consistently delicious. At this point I've had almost every pasta dish on the menu, as well as their pizza and chicken parm. I've never had anything I didn't like, but their pasta is amazing. Always cooked to perfection. My favorite is the rigatoni, but the gnocchi with Gorgonzola cream is a close second. Definitely the best pasta I've had in the city.

uQ3mskW7fY5FBfQQsUSA9A.text: This is definitely not a good way to spend your hard earned money. We wanted to have Italian food and pizza. We thought we would give it a try. Wrong decision!! It was a Saturday night so I understand they may have been busy.  The restaurant was not busy enough  to have an excuse for poor training of staff , food that was below average that took forever and management who obviously did not care.  I highly recommend not visiting this restaurant if you are looking for good service and good food.

NFPvYfde0SUarNjs0sgB-w.text: We came here on a Monday for dinner. The place was a ghost town- maybe a total of 8 within the entire restaurant. We were greeted, upon seating, by our server who was currently in training (looked to be in high school). I was surprised to not see any senior staff with him throughout the night. It would have been nice to have been walked through the menu as this was our first time here. No biggie- we reviewed the menu ourselves.  We ordered a Wicked Weed beer and a glass of wine, but they ended up being out of the beer we ordered so we just opted for water and a coke. We started our meals with a ceasar and wedge salad (+$4.50 to add to your meal). I got the wedge and it was great. I loved the dressing and the gorgonzola cheese was super tasty. The ceasar salad was served as 'deconstructed', which I'll never understand why they do that anywhere (besides a wedge obviously!), but my husband said it was good. Both salads were large servings for a "side salad". We also got bread and a bruschetta style dipping sauce that was tasty.  My husband was in the mood for chicken fettuccini alfredo, but didn't see it on the menu. We asked our server and he said they could make it for him ($22.50). I got the chicken tomato basil pasta ($18). I guess I should of known better, but my pasta was actual 'tomato basil fettuccine'. I thought the sauce (cognac cream sauce) would have tasted like tomato basil. There wasn't much tomato or basil flavor within the dish at all, however it was good- just not what I was expecting. My husband's alfredo was OK, but for $23 we just expected more flavor and creaminess to it.   Overall, not sure if I would be the first to recommend or jump to go back to Luciano's, which is a disappointment because we were really looking forward to it. Maybe it was because we went on a Monday and it was so quiet and awkward in the place, or because we ordered the wrong thing- but we didn't have much guidance. I know I'm a Yelper and should do my research before going into restaurants, but I also expect a higher level of service from nicer, established places in Charlotte.

emMuFG__jPueUaixUZGw2w.text: First time was great food. The second I did not enjoy it much. Fresh but not great. Tiramisu too much of the filling to the ratio of lady fingers. Caesar salad was good. The dipping sauce served with the bread is amazing though. Recommend having some of that. Service make up for the food on my last visit

yf-FUllEqc05BdHvnmq00A.text: Definitely one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! Great atmosphere, excellent food (plenty of gluten free options), and top notch service!

mlSuHb8nNwbhw7BGCoO7tA.text: Very loud restaurant. Not enough help. Seated 25 minutes after my reservation.   Not to mention I suffered from food poisoning 4 hrs after dinner. Diners beware!

8Ytx9qtBu6reJmgh0m80_A.text: Luciano's is an excellent restaurant! In the previous weeks we have been twice. My husband had an extremely successful company celebration that was catered to perfection. Afterward we went with a group of buddies and had a wonderful dinner. Their menu is altered, as is their wine. Their Barolo was excellent! I hear the do brunch, that might be my next visit!

XB3QV7L30F4uGENuaCfP0Q.text: Fantastic as always.  This is the third time I ate here and the food is always excellent as well as the service.  You cant go wrong with this restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States

O7nAegkfEz-wfjCg4y9egw.text: Appetizers were the star of the show and they push Luciano's into the 4-star category. The desert, Zeppole, was rich and sticky as it should have been but I was a little disappointed by the entree. The pasta was a little dry and possibly over-seasoned.  I'm still giving the experience 4-stars as the decor was good and the service was excellent. It is a bit odd having NFL on television in an establishment with chandeliers - odd.

3PFk5oVzbfC5omgujXRBMQ.text: My husband and I went to Luciano's for the first time last night.   Phillip, our waiter, provided excellent service. He had great recommendations and struck the perfect balance of giving us time to enjoy but also make sure we were attended to. If you can, ask for him when you eat there!   The ambiance is lovely and on Friday nights, they have live music. Romantic for a date night but also great for a group. The sun dried tomato tapenade they serve with the bread is incredible!   Being a vegetarian, they happily altered the gnocchi dish to suit my dietary needs. My husband had the chicken parmesean and loved it.   The pear margarita was delicious! Would highly recommend it if you love margaritas.

mq3IlgnofXZcabQYQiggfQ.text: The atmosphere is very nice. my husband and I went there for lunch. The food was OK. shortly after we left and I got home, my stomach did not agree with their swordfish. Let's just say I spent some time in the restroom. Not sure what happened there. No plans on going back to this restaurant. take the risk if you're curious.

UvNq16UiEIAE9iOmPQYgaQ.text: I have been her at least 6 times in the last year for lunch and for dinner.  It is always wonderful.  The tomato oil dip is kind of amazing.  And the bread is some of the best in Charlotte.  Charlotte does not have a lot of good bread options.  I had chicken piccata, husband had osso bucco, other couple had shrimp diavalo with pasta and scallops with mushroom risotto.  Finished with tiramisu.  Everyone raved.  Will definitely be returning.  Thanks, Luciano's!

3WAREGA8DrcWGru6Z4-tpw.text: Another fine meal at Luciano's.  Great place to stop before a show though traffic approaching it on South Boulevard can be tough.  Love the veal here and pasta dishes I've had are tasty.  A little pricier than the local place we often go but fine quality in a nicely appointed setting for an evening out.

-PxiQBPVstZp96nivDRS3Q.text: I was not impressed. Everything was just ok, and I expected a lot more.   I went Monday night with a group of 10 people. First of all the waiter tried hard to sell us on everything, from the specialty drinks to dessert and coffee. This is great, except whenever the answer was no, he seemed upset and made a "joking" comment. It was very odd. Service was also very slow which I didn't understand because there wasn't much of a crowd there. It took about 10 minutes just to get more bread.   As for the food - it was average for an Italian restaurant, so in my opinion, not worth the price. I had eggplant parm which was totally overcooked. The eggplant was pretty much mush, but the taste of the cheese and sauce was good. Oh I also had a chopped salad that would have been good but it was way over dressed.   The general consensus around the table was that the food was good. But no one raved about it.  I might return to try some appetizers because they looked pretty tasty. But I definitely won't be back for a full meal.   Oh they also had an extensive wine list for the wine lovers out there. If thats something you would enjoy that would be a plus.

Dp-KNm8lYzDtqIoJz9aZvQ.text: I was visiting Charlotte and was not disappointed with their food. The calamari friti was easily some of the best I've ever had, they fry bell peppers with the calamari to give it an amazing flavor. Then for dinner I had their signature eggplant parmesan and let me tell you, THE BEST! It's better than my family's receive and the eggplant and pasta were cooked PERFECTLY. The tiramisu for dessert was to die for as well. I can't wait to come back here. My husband and father ordered their brick oven homemade pizzas, they both said it was some of the best pizza they've had.

qAuGaj5u6cQh6lMemhS1DQ.text: This place has a good atmosphere and is perfect for date night drinks at the bar. Wednesday nights are half priced bottles of wine, so even more of a reason to bring a date or friend. The food on the other hand left something to be desired. When I came here I had the eggplant Parmesan which came with a side of pasta. The dish lacked flavor and I hate to say, a frozen dinner would have tasted just as good. The others in my party came to the same conclusion so I wouldn't be able to say that it was just the dish I ordered.

NszqCnoOW5kLbpWv-DxcPQ.text: I absolutely loved this restaurant. Visited from out of town on business and dined here last night. From the decor to the service to the food it is a must goto place! I had shrimp & calamari as an app. The pizza looked incredible but I didn't get a piece..bread was delicious! I had the seabass over rostr potatoes and veggies wow! Soooo good. We also had dessert: mini doughnuts filled with nutella were a stand-out plus I really liked the tiramisu. Make this part of your meal plan if your in the area. Can't wait to visit again.

ojY-A08euZnS95pkayp15A.text: This is a great place for a date night but we went for a girls night out (table for three please). On Friday nights they have live music which definitely added to the romantic atmosphere. Our wine and food was all fantastic. Will definitely be back again.

-122HaKpTPK0d4yewspSoQ.text: Great Italian! The pasta I ordered was cooked to al dente perfection and the pasta sauce and sausage was excellent. My fiance had the lasagna and he already wants to go back and order it again. My only criticism is with the sauce that came with the bread to start dinner. The bread was great but the red sauce for dipping was strange and hard to share with our group of 4.

OvPXYlU260gx_PVmxvGC-Q.text: Wow, we were blown away. Luciano's is an absolute treat. The short rib ossobucco is the best I've ever had and my wife loved the marsala. Our service was fantastic, Anthony paired us with a superb bottle of Charles Krug.   Great experience, we can't wait to go back.

G3UKHTFYKx4chuaczFwYKA.text: Had an amazing time with a large group of friends!  The atmosphere and food were top-notch!  We had a wonderful sampling of appetizers, veal meatballs, carpaccio, and calamari, all were divine!    Everyone raved about their main courses, which ranged from fettuccini alfredo to the flat bread pizzas  I encourage everyone to go and give this place a try!

NAO-D7HMZS_y0Y5bEU9w3A.text: O.M.Goodness! So good! I had the gnocchi, my husband had the Zuppa Di Mare. He loved it, and the gnocchi was soo good!. Very nice atmosphere. Nice staff. Great experience :)

1uhejaJdN1JKkuStEFGpYw.text: This place was amazing and the food was delicious! Service was great and the waiter checked on us most of the time to make sure everything was okay. The Antipasti board was PHENOMENAL, and the Shrimp Fra Diavola was one of the best I've ever had. If you are in the mood for good Italian, definitely try this place out!

LZFHoxqpIpk42i6GvzVn2A.text: Everything I had was great. Went for a business dinner- they have a quiet separate room you can use. We did the prefixed menu which was perfect. Lots of food. I tried the meatballs and flatbread which I liked, wedge salad, shrimp and crab ravioli which was great and amazing tiramisu. I didn't even realized I liked tiramisu...so good. Half priced bottles of wine on Wednesday (atleast when I went) and service was excellent. If I could give 4 1/2 stars I would. The chicken wasn't a fan favorite so I can't give 5 stars but everything that I tried I really liked

XUlYpZK5Nf1Gs5H8g78YrQ.text: Excellent but very rich foods, prices are moderate all things considered, watch out for that waist line.   FWIW there's a $13 lunch deal . Today it was tomato basil w/italian sausage bisque or salad, then salmon, swordfish or spicy pasta and desert. I think considering the quality it's a bargain.   We decided to order a la carte instead but I thought I should help get the word out there. This is what we ate instead.  They first bring out a complimentary dip with a basket of Italian country bread. The REAL thing, not the pretty looking but crap tasting imitations that all supermarkets sell, the bread, the bread ...   5 stars  I didn't care one bit for the dip, although my S.O. liked it just fine. It's some red pesto heavy with sun dried tomatoes, too heavy for my taste I'd rather dip in the traditional olive oil with balsamic and herbs or pepper - No rating  Mussels in white wine ($8)  A surprisingly large serving for the price and the sauce was excellent, good enough to dunk and even slurp a couple of spoonfuls but richer with butter than it needs to be.  The quality of the mussels themselves was just so-so. Some were gritty, there were shards of broken shells, some had failed to open. 3 1/2 stars  Scallops and artichoke linguini w/pancetta in garlic butter ($16)  Three huge and sweet scallops, tasty artichoke and al dente linguini, altogether a really nice dish. The thing is I personally tired of  pasta in cream sauces years ago and this sauce left the pasta a bit gooey and tasted more like a light cream sauce than just butter and garlic.  3 1/2 stars  Zuppa di Mare ($24) not a soup. Catch of the day w/mussels, clams, squid, shrimp and scallops in tomato broth with garlic bread. I just spooned the plate dry of the broth, I'd give 5 stars for the garlic bread and the broth alone it was delicious bar none... but the seafood itself?   The catch of the day was salmon, which I think not the best choice for this zuppa, and there was tons and tons of it, more than I wanted with one big scallop, two small shrimps and a tiny bit of shellfish. Not what I had in mind, for the record this is a dish I often order when it's in the menu. (5+3) /2 = 4 stars so close yet so far...  The decor is borderline kitschy what with all those columns but the designer put it together really well, the nearly monochromatic dining room is sober, elegant and cozy at the same time .... and the service couldn't be better.

YR2b4KvJLqMkjqw9iwFiQg.text: The food and service at Luciano's is amazing. If you want the best lasagna or eggplant Parmesan in town this is the place to go.

U9tKdqujBUE0xFx09mKIBg.text: Stumbled upon this gem while in Charlotte.  Gorgeous decor, fantastic service, romantic atmosphere, and delicious food!

xyDQ1_mwygEeBodOz9ZShA.text: Tried this place the other night - Top notch service.  The Pasta was excellent. I had the veal marsala and it was a tad over cooked but still quite tasty. Also had the a pair of cannolis and they were fresh and very good.  The value is the real story here. Awesome Service at a price that makes it easy to frequent without feeling guilty.  I'm a fan.

A5lvO7q1Djh9KMcuOMInyA.text: One of the best Italian restaurants I've ever been to. I had the gnocchi which was delicious, but very creamy and rich. My boyfriend had spaghetti and meatballs which he said was delicious!

bisDQ0L8eY5K2g5Bkcqu9Q.text: I wanted to eat Italian in Charlotte and. Jose Luciano's because it had such good reviews on Yelp.  Well it deserves the good reviews it's fantastic.  Our server Louise was informative, attentive and recommended well.  The scallop special was great, the fish with Tuscan beans was tremendous but the grilled Octopus appetizer was the star of the show.   Tender and served on the tastiest chick peas. Since it was Wednesday night bottles of wines were half price.  I had a delicious Malbec and was able to take some home.  Overall just about the beat Italian experience to be had in Charlotte.

zjrkT3ItOGb42hs1t-uFIA.text: My favorite italian spot in town - been here a few times already. The appetizers are my favorite (love the carpaccio and the calamari), the pasta is always fresh and the wine selection is great. But the real highlight is the service - A+!

1rk4OyE2ccIHNqmC1ACOJw.text: It was our first night here.  It was hectic for the staff as it was restaurant week.  Service was great.  The food was wonderful.  Some in our party mixed items from the Queen's Feast Menu with the regular menu. All items were great!  Hats off to this place.  We will definitely be back.

KWVEuZWjhOv6kuB7mqbEPw.text: Amazing food! Love Love Love ! So happy they opened a location in Charlotte!  Try grilled octopus!  Pizza is amazing  I love my Ceasar Salad  Every friend I introduced this place to, loved it!

fxkXN5ml8n4yyMfoaKLGHQ.text: I work upstairs and they stay open late for lunch, so I decided this place was perfect for me for lunch the other day.  I sat outside so can't comment much on the decor inside, though definitely a huge change from the La Paz days.  Service from hostess to server to busser to food runner was all very nice.  The bread is excellent, I think it was my favorite part of the meal!  It was so warm and fresh, a nice crustiness to it.  Its served with a sun dried tomato spread and I actually liked it, not being a huge SDT fan.  I got a salad and a pizza for lunch.  Here is where I am annoyed.  I asked is that too much food, the server assures me not at all.  Lie!!  The salad was entree size and I ate less than half.  Look I get that it pads his check, but I respect you more for your honesty and that's what makes me a repeat customer.  The salad wasn't great though, it was a chopped salad and it was drowned it dressing and some of the lettuce was sad and limp.  And not really chopped, I expected smaller pieces for a chopped salad, but that's me being nit picky I guess.  My entree was the vegetarian pizza.  I was excited for this.  And then I was pissed.  They covered it in red pepper flakes.  I didn't request this, it wasn't on the menu and I have 0 tolerance for spicy food.  So I sat there trying to pick the pieces out while my lips and mouth burned and I seethed.  I of course said nothing because it was already getting late and my hour for lunch was quickly ending so I just took it as a lesson learned, next time I will explicitly tell them to not add anything other than that which is stated on the menu!  I gave 3 stars because I am not ready to write them off yet.  They are convenient for me for lunch so I want them to succeed.  But maybe a little more time to get all the kinks worked out before I try again.

MRGV8HXOYvRxZl6MxAjuxw.text: From what I was told, Luciano's had been open for only a week or two when I ate here in early May. The ambiance was somewhere between casual and upscale, with lighting that was dim enough for a comfortable dinner and nice ambient lighting around the ceiling. I was with a party with mixed attire -- some jeans, some shirts and ties, the women in skirts and blouses -- and no one seemed to have a problem with it. There's a lovely patio, but I don't care for eating outside so I'd be unlikely to sit there.  I would go to Luciano's just for the strawberry panna cotta alone. This was my first time ever eating panna cotta and it was a life-changing moment for a girl who loves her sweets. In all honesty, two of those stars are for the dessert, one and a half are for the meal, and one and a half are for the service and atmosphere.  As for the meal itself, I had a luscious black spaghetti with bay scallops, shrimp, and mussels; the menu online indicates that it's black linguine but I suppose they might have changed that since the menu was created. The peppery tomato sauce was gorgeous. My husband had salmon oreganata, which I got to taste and I enjoyed it. As a bread lover, I had to make myself stop eating the complimentary bread and sundried tomato spread that the server brought out before the meal. My friend ordered goat cheese pomodoro to share and I could gladly make a meal of that. The food was all tasty and worth the price.   Service was attentive and welcoming, including a visit to our table from the manager. All of the staff did their jobs well and with pride.  On a small side note, I appreciated that the ladies' room had a bottle of mouthwash and little cups on a side table. We were going out after the meal and I didn't want my breath to smell of garlic. Maybe I just don't go to enough classy joints to have encountered this before, but I liked it.  Luciano's will definitely be on my list of good places to go for Italian food.

GNM1jr-bnnIqqEiYSrIqvw.text: We enjoyed our visit to Luciano's before a night at the theater. The atmosphere is pleasant and we had great service from Alberto. The dishes we enjoyed included the gnocchi (which was able to be prepared vegetarian), capellini bolognese, & spaghetti & meatballs. We also enjoyed well-crafted cocktails & a great Italian Sangiovese-Merlot blend.

7F4Z5oTfKWbYmT-sCmK_Ag.text: What a beautiful transformation to this former La Paz! I've been here twice in three weeks!   Upon entering, we were greeted immediately and friendly. The team of service staff is knowledgeable, friendly, and truly exceptional.   Their complementary warm crusty bread with sundries tomato is wonderful.  I had the Mussels Bianco for an appetizer on my first visit, it's so delicious, that I insisted having it again for my second. The sauce is so good we asked for more bread to dip into it!  The first visit, I had trouble deciding between the Gnocchi and the Ravioli Al Forno. I chose the Gnocchi. I was simply wonderful, tender and flavorful. I forced myself to stop eating it so I would have leftovers. My friend enjoyed the Eggplant Parmigiana .   For my second visit, I knew I was having the Ravioli and was not disappointed at all! I liked it as much if not better than the Gnocchi! Again, my friends also enjoyed their meals, one had a pasta dish, although I don't know which one, and as last time, the Eggplant Parmigiana was a hit.   This time we had desert, Peach Cobbler and Tiramisu. Both were enjoyable.   The red wine was slightly chilled which is a plus and I enjoyed the Menabrea Amber beer.  The prices and portions are great.    We decided that we will just work our way down the menu since everything is top notch!   I can't wait to share this great restaurant with more friends!

VgKm_W5OXiWXgRJV1VC5vA.text: After seeing the previous reviews, I was very anxious to visit Luciano's. Upon arrival, the restaurant has been truly renovated since the La Paz ownership & is beautiful. We sat outside and enjoyed the bread and sun dried tomato dipping sauce with proseco, which was very good. We decided to start with the octopus appetizer, which was undercooked, chewy and overall not something I would enjoy again. We explained the issue to the waiter and shortly after our waiter and the manager approached the table to apologize. The chef tasted it & realized it was very undercooked and threw that batch away. A few minutes later they brought a complimentary calamari, very nice, but that was just as undercooked as the octopus.  On to the entrees...we ordered the chicken piccata & the gnocchi. The chicken was ok, however, the entire plate was oil, and I mean dripping! As for the gnocchi, another uncooked meal. They were doughy and mush. I hate to write this, because I did expect better, but for now I will stick with a few other Italian restaurants that are much better, and maybe give them another shot after a few more months in business.

an2oV7In3K1xevbNIZOA2A.text: We both had specials.  Incredible.  Bread and dipping sauce are complimentary.  Limited local brew selection.  The food was incredible.  Perfectly cooked.  Both specials we had were seafood based and were delicious.   Good service, too.

ivnwi0P6sXbPB1BLchZBPA.text: My friend and I ate here on a Monday night - very empty dining room but packed bar due to an event that moved into a private room.    I agree that the bread and tomato oil was lovely - a pleasant surprise.  We both ordered the Mista Salad.  I would have preferred to see more pine nuts and tomatoes.  It mostly greens.  The Prosciutto Pizza was scrumptious - the amount of prosciutto was amazing - heaps!  We then split the Rigatoni Salsiccia but subsitited a non-spicy sauce.  It was loaded with mozzarella, peppers and sausage.  I really enjoyed it.  No room for dessert!!!!!!!!!!  Our waiter seemed to be a little out of it - he had to read the specials from his notes, asked us to repeat our orders a couple of times and then disappeared when we tried to get the check.  When I ordered a glass of the Quattro Mani.  He asked which one.  I had specifically checked that there was only one Quattro Mani.    I would definitely go back!

fJ6CuqDKheDyHKEfIxWJrQ.text: Delicious Food! Fabulous server (Allison). Wonderful attention to detail--we all loved our entrees.

T7cPYxT7Y6iGcOuilwSC0w.text: Had a great lunch with friends today. The carpaccio w/truffle oil was to die for. They also do a very respectable calamari. We tried the lunch  combo's; choice of salad, sandwich & dessert for $12ish. Service is solid except our waiters name was Roy! Shouldn't it be mandatory that they be named Guido or perhaps Alberto. We had fun with that!

5cM-tRFTz05fS6ARe7ftuQ.text: Had a late lunch at Luciano's - my first visit. Lovely decor, and the menu looked good. They offered a 3- course Salad-main-dessert at lunch for $12.95. The Cesar's salad was excellent - fresh crisp, lighted dressed and served on a chilled plate. Good start! However, the main course was a pasta dish that was inedible. And could I even find a waiter or bus boy to bring me salt & pepper? No. Finally the manager realized I wasn't eating and no one was around, so she asked me about the food, and quickly offered to bring me something else. That was classy. (Just for reference - I don't think I've EVER sent back a meal at a fine dining restaurant. I'm not that type of picky patron, but I just couldn't swallow this dish.) Unfortunately, even after the second main course arrived, I couldn't get my waitress' attention to get the check for what seemed like days. Between the dreadful pasta and the poor service, I doubt I'll ever be back in spite of the fact that I give the Manager kudos for handling a difficult situation gracefully.

9Kx2TY8O8GUFm1sk7brv8Q.text: Went to Luciano's last night and was reminded why we had not been there in a while. Drinks, ambience, service were all great but my eggplant parm was awful. When the manager asked if I wanted it wrapped up and I told him I did not care for it, he offered nothing for my disappointment, inspite of the fact that I was picking up the bill for the table. So unless you are looking for tasteless chunks of eggplant with sauce and cheese on top, don't order the eggplant parm. Their inconsistency makes it too risky to want to go back.

luE3bLJmIRrAlqIP7bdiOQ.text: I was craving scallops and hoped this place would be able to satisfy that craving. They have an Italian vodka Moscow Mule which I was very excited to try. It had a weird taste that I wasn't a fan of. As for my dinner, the scallops were not cleaned properly. I was crunching on the sand that was not cleaned from the scallops. They came on a bed of lemon butter noodles that tasted like someone poured lemonade on my noodles. They were bland and not at all satisfying. The atmosphere and setting is nice, but not enough to come back for again.

9WJ_Z4VatQIdT77fsu9NdQ.text: Last night my kid asked for Italian for dinner and since we were uptown I quickly scrolled through Yelp and found Luciano was just around the corner in South End. At 6 pm the restaurant was close to empty. We asked to sit outside (big mistake-the traffic was loud and it was hot) and we're informed that they offered a Queen's Feast menu. The Queen's Feast features an appetizer, entree, and dessert for $35. We opted for the QF menu since it typically serves as a sampling of what a restaurant has to offer and should include some of their best and most popular dishes. We chose the grilled asparagus appetizer, bruschetta appetizer, filet mignon w/whipped sweet potatoes + sauteed spinach, lobster ravioli, and the strawberry shortcake + coconut panna cotta.   So here's the rundown: Appetizers: were great, they were flavorful and had a unique spin.   Entrees: The entrees were lackluster. The ravioli tasted like ocean water that's all we could taste. The filling was almost pureed and did not resemble the normal taste nor texture of ravioli. The sauce that accompanied the ravioli was gelatinous and also tasted like ocean water. It was very disappointing. The filet mignon was perfectly cooked but some also lacked flavor...some cracked black pepper would have done it some justice. The sweet potatoes tasted like cream...some may like that but I prefer my sweet potatoes to taste like sweet potatoes.   Desserts: The desserts were the saving grace of our meal. The panna cotta was perfect and I loved the toasted coconut on top. The strawberry shortcake was equally delicious and the texture was airy and moist.   Overall the experience was so-so. Service was extremely slow. After the appetizers, my kids received their meals (spaghetti and pizza), we were informed by our waiter that our main courses would be out in 3-5 minutes. Almost 20 minutes later, our main courses arrived and as mentioned above our main courses were very disappointing. On the positive note: the kids meals were generous portions and my kids enjoyed them. I also liked the price point for the kids selections but I doubt we'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Kids menu with a lot of different choices
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled asparagus w/blue cheese &amp; crispy onions
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bruschetta

H7DBwxjYQ2LbY7iX78Bj_w.text: The prices were in-line with the portions and quality of food. I ordered the Chicken Parmigiana which came with a smaller portion of spaghetti and marinara. The chicken was heavily breaded, which I don't mind at all. I also added a side salad with house dressing and was also a decent size.I did love the house dressing. When we sat, we were offered french bread with a tomato dipping sauce. The food was good but didn't really blow my socks off - but is probably because I went with a common dish. Next time, I will order a seafood dish I think.  The restaurant is very nice inside decor wise and is a great place to come for a work dinner. I did also really like that the restaurant offered mouthwash in the restroom so you don't have to go home with garlic breath! The table service was also great.   I enjoyed my dining experience here, but parking was so confusing. There was a valet person, but I think he might have been there for a salon, and many parking spots were blocked with cones. I parked in a packing garage next to the restaurant.   I would come here again for a work dinner, but the dining experience or food isn't a place I would come back for a date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken Parmigiana
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mouthwash in the women&#39;s bathroom!! Say what??!

eLz10LCfx-5TU6lNn_Lg4A.text: The vegetarian pasta dishes were one of a kind here. It is obvious that they make these dishes fresh. We enjoyed the Spinach Tortellini and Mushroom Ravioli. Both great vegetarian options. The sauce was so creamy and light at the same time. I loved the free bread and marinara they gave too. Not a lot of Italian places do that. Overall I will give this place a five star review for great food, ambiance, and yummy free appetizer!

5HjxGCjpOsw90jNMuzsXSw.text: Nice place. Formal yet casual. White table cloths but their servers wear jeans. We weren't dressed to the nines and felt comfortable.   Our server was knowledgeable and attentive. The food was tasty and on the pricey side but still reasonable enough. My husband ordered a pasta dish with shrimp and the tails were still on. I understand some of the reason behind this but it's annoying to de-tail shrimp covered in sauce. He also ordered the chicken but got shrimp. No big deal but just not what he ordered. He liked it so we didn't send it back.   The dessert was a bit of a joke though. We work in the industry and recognized our dessert from the frozen section of Sysco's dessert menu the second be bit into it. It wouldn't matter as much if they didn't charge us $9.00 for it.  Their accommodations in the bathrooms were a nice touch, mouth wash and quality soap and towels. It's a funny thing to enjoy but it does add that luxury experience.  We noticed the manager popping in and out of the dining room but he never stopped at a single table. That's just a pet peeve as a manager. Please talk to your guests if you have time. It's important to get feed back other than the internet.  All in all, the pasta dishes we had were good. The bread service with their pepper and oil dip was tasty. The wine list was fair, though pricy. I understand why they charge as much as they do but for the love of God it's not that hard to make Chocolate mousse in house.  The end

GJHtfNh9oA4Ora908UyP3Q.text: We actually kept ending up at this place right after it opened. But we loved it. It was like the whole restaurant was just for us. The first day (yeah, we went back to back) we thought they had brunch i on Saturdays, but they don't. We had to get lunch. My carbonara was delicious. My friends enjoyed their dishes. Our server, Andrew was awesome. He's also Italian so he pronounces things as they should be. It was nice to have someone who knew what they were talking about. We wanted to know what brunch was actually like so we went back Sunday. Andrew wasn't there  but the French Toast and Biscuit Benedict were good, plus it was WAY more food than I thought it would be. I will definitely go back the next time I'm in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuit Benedict
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. French Toast

iSzTX3BWg95biPuoQlCXtg.text: We had dinner to celebrate my birthday, to start the waiter brought some fresh out of the oven bread with olive oil / tomato dip. It tasted very good had a side Caesar salad the dressing wasn't lite but wasn't overpowering the salad I could tell they take pride in their food. For my main dish I ordered the chicken Fra Diavalo the portion was perfect for leftovers. Lastly we finished with Zeppole's  there ricotta cheese filled doughnuts stuffed with Nutella chocolate. It was a memorable night spent with family. Would return!

b-KB31ve7sp6LCktpBHP8g.text: Pretty decent food, good drinks and vibrant ambience with good service. Lot of food, drinks and dessert options. We liked the food and definitely the desserts ;) but the food is Little expensive. Recommend for date nights or celebrating occasions.

zvPaX6wcv-olWCH6_-78jg.text: My boyfriend and I stumbled upon Luciano's for dinner kind of accidentally on a Wednesday night and we hit the jackpot. It was half off wine and had delicious authentic Italian cuisine! We shared a delicious bottle of Pinot Grigio that was only $18 and started off with some warm, fresh-out-of-the-oven bread with an olive oil/tomato dip. We ordered a caesar salad and tomato soup to start, and they were delicious. The tomato soup was really outstanding--creamy and flavorful. For our main dishes, we ordered the Linguine Carbonara and the Tortelloni. While both were delicious, the brown butter on my Tortelloni was slightly too greasy and over-powering. The walnuts on my tortelloni also felt like an afterthought. However, the ricotta filling was refreshing and made the dish really outstanding.  The menu is extensive, so it definitely warrants another visit soon!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brown butter Tortelloni

GkzCsPTjCxFwffKyQGSt0Q.text: Food was good, However our waiter was so stand offish and silent it was like pulling teeth to get a water refill. He didn't look us in the eyes once and acted miserable the entire time. Really ruined the entire dinner vibe and made us feel uncomfortable.

mVUiPa7ug2ONRy5wu_Bx5A.text: This used to be a great place not sure what happened, we reached out to them privately before posting to see if it was a fluke but with no response from them I feel I need to let others know, the service, the food and the atmosphere were horrible.  Brunch, no music on, played it on my iphone and still none, service was sad to say the least and the food was not up to par. Waiter tried to take my mimosa away before I WAS DONE,  never asked us what sides we wanted so we got what I guess he said we wanted, the bread was not good and that is hard to mess up, the food was so so, not cooked properly etc...we wont be back its too bad really.

FpWpglCmWE6M6woos7a_9A.text: Came here for my mom's bday dinner, last minute reservation because the original restaurant was too backed up. My parents had been here before on a weeknight and liked it, so we figured why not. They sat us immediately which was great. Our server was nice, sometimes hard to find, but otherwise not bad. The drink times were a little crazy, it seemed like the only had one bartender for a weekend night so we had to wait quite a while for drinks to be served. We started off with the burrata and goat cheese appetizers (mom is veggie and she loves cheese), and they were both good, and came out super quickly. A few of us got Caesar salads, and everyone's had the butts of the romaine in it, I personally don't mind them, but my wife and brothers were browning and dirty. For main, everyone got various pastas and meats, veggie flatbread was good, mushroom ravioli was super salty bc of the breadcrumbs, other pastas were decent. I got the lamb, and asked for medium, it came out more of a well done, I didn't mind that too much, but my main gripe was the veggie and sauce, the alcohol in the sauce wasn't cooked off, and since the whole dish was soaked in this sauce, everything including the lamb had that taste. We had a tuxedo cake and tiramisu for dessert, again both decent, tiramisu came out collapsed in a blob, but the flavor wasn't bad. All in all, I'd maybe try again on a weekday, but my main concern was for The prices the food quality has to be on point. $45 for 3 overcooked double lamb chops covered in some sort tomato sauce with raw alcohol is a little too much.

08H_i6_2ctOeIG3prhTrXA.text: Thank you for taking reservations with Open Table! I wish all restaurants did this. Yummy chicken parmigiana!! Great service too!

v9IBq5D5UfU7WFNS-QO2cA.text: We stumbled upon Luciano's one night when tried to get into our favorite local South End restaurant. We were with another couple and decided to walk to find a place to eat.   I actually didn't even realize Luciano's existed where it was, I must have driven past a dozen times or so.   On a busy Saturday night we were seated in the middle of the restaurant immediately.   The server was very kind and prompt.   When we sat the waiter placed down bread with a tomato dipping sauce. It tasted good, wasn't anything super memorable. I ordered the eggplant parmigana. It came out of the oven steaming hot. It was perfectly crisp, but not oily. The portion size was normal too - not overly large or too small. I thought the food was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. Next time I will order a special dish.  The decor on the inside is really nice. It felt like a more expensive restaurant then it was - which was nice.  We'll definitely come back - hope to have a dish that really wows me!

c6tGnFft1x58mByBKtmE-Q.text: Awful brunch experience. The restaurant was almost completely empty, we had a large party. It took an hour and 20 minutes for us to get our food. Most of our food came out cold - our meals came with potatoes and could be substituted with hash-browns. Server came back to say he didn't have hash browns 20 minutes after we had put in our order, then our food came out but the refill potatoes came out 10 minutes after our food. Thankfully those were hot. We were told they only had enough OJ for 3 mimosas, so we could not order more. He server was nice enough to take the cake to the kitchen and cut it. Worse service and food I've had in Charlotte. Sad we were excited about going there as we were celebrating a birthday.

RrezcA7KmFbH-iLXJR8tKA.text: This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in town. We could feel the freshness in the food served. Everything was served quickly and taste was on point. Their dessert is a must try.

Q7ODvHkd_fgLD31ZSOECcQ.text: Cute little Italian restaurant with great attentive staff and a "romantic" relaxing atmosphere. The apple cider Tini was great with even a slice of apple. The bread and dip served with the meal was hot a fresh, INCREDIBLE! And the chicken linguini carbonara was very good. Creamy with no overpowering flavors and a good portion size. The flavors were a great blend in anything and I had a great night. The staff really made it a 5/5 for me.

MVGQxiSX7Y-xwPBdQArXHw.text: I have been to this his restaurant several times. I am heavily tattooed yet I make good money and have a decent job. Yet the time my son and I went here without my husband they acted like I was trash and even called the police without me even knowing what was gonna on to "get me out of there." They said that I was neglecting my child by being on facetime next to the table! Yet left out the part where my son was also on his device. Even the cops were confused and just let me leave. But it was humiliating! A WAITRESS doesn't get to make the call on who looks good in their restaurant! Discrimination! I was enjoying my meal and looked up to the police surrounding me and I had ZERO IDEA what was going on! They also said I was inebriated, yet they hadn't even served me a drink! And I DO NOT DRINK. I'll never forget it! If you aren't a white Christian male I'd be wary of eating here! I was so close to using my influencer status on Instagram to publicly bash this restaurant for discrimination, but I was even too humiliated to do that! Before they judge, they should know who they are dealing with! I was not rude, nothing to deserve what happened! I was blindsided and I'm still in awe to this day about it! They did not ask me to leave or say anything! They acted like everything was fine and then called the police to get me out of there and open up a table for the incoming lunch rush! I hope that the waitress got FIRED! My BABY was with me and everything!!!!!! He could have gotten taken away and put into a horrible, dangerous, poverty level foster home all so that they can keep up the reputation of their restaurant to not house hipsters and ethnic ppl! There is no other excuse for why they called! If there was then the police wouldn't have came, been totally confused, and then let me just leave without any sort of warning or ANYTHING! WATCH OUT!

s_OJqI8PML7_QrDAgYo0Cg.text: We had our rehearsal dinner here a few weeks ago and all we can say is WOW!  Every part of the process was a great experience!  The staff worked with us to create a custom menu for our party of about 25 people, designing the private party room, tasting wines to offer for the dinner and setting up AV projection so we could show pictures during our special night with our nearest and dearest.  Shout out to Ronald Vera who helped us with planning and meeting all of our needs, and also his wonderful staff for their amazing and attentive service that night!  Everything was wonderful and the food was delicious, as always!
