Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Private dining room

fdB5pVrD5ZJItLq05GoMQA.text: Monday lunch, arrived around Noon.  There were three or 4 other parties seated.  We were promptly seated.    Let me say, Luciano's is one of my faves for Italian in CLT.  However, it took them 10 min. To figure out who our server was going to be.  That was weird!  Lady brought us waters and I asked if she was our server?  She said she wasn't sure.  Another man asked if we had be talked to, I said no.  Then the water server came back.   Bread was delicious as usual...  I asked her what the soup of the day was??  She said WHITE bean and sausage with vegetables,  I said, it probably doesn't, but could you just double check that it doesn't have peas.  She said sure, do you still want it if it does??  I said absolutely not, please let me know if it does and I'll make another selection.  She came back to tell me it just has carrots, I said great.  Then as she's walking away... and lentils.  I said to my Sister, did she say lentils?  I think so, weird I've never heard of white bean and lentil soup!  Of course it came as all lentil soup.  She offered to go back and see if they had any white beans to put it!   Sister ordered penne with chicken/ broccoli  blue cheese Alfredo sauce.  $15.    Very disappointing!!! Worst meal ever there.  Sauce was watery, thin and lack flavor.  What little there was went to the bottom of the bowl.  Chicken tasted like microwave reheated tough meat. I tried it, then a manager came by and we showed him. They brought her another chicken breast and extra sauce.  Even though you could tell this chicken was freshly cooked, it was a little rubbery. I'm not sure if they use the highest quality meat?? The sauce was better, but still lacked flavor.   I guess I'll have to stick with eating there in the evening, and the gnocchi which I love. I hope that the evening meals haven't went downhill. Not sure I'll be back anytime soon, which is very disappointing.  Because I use to tell everyone that this was one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte. A couple years ago I went here for lunch, and had an amazing experience. I guess you win some and you lose some. I'm not the type of person that repeat restaurants in less I love them, sorry to say my Love was lost  yesterday.  To many other choices to pick from for $15 penne!

wDcDffz8AQZYHQspqsnI5w.text: In Charlotte for 1 night for business and stopped in for dinner. Great place!!!! Had chicken parm, my co-worker had lasagne, and we had the zeppolis for desert!!! Fantastic service, great food and great atmosphere!!! Will be back for sure next time I'm in Charlotte.

4H0-mnuIAdC-ABvVSfDmfQ.text: I was actually really really excited about this place as my boyfriend and I absolutely adore Italian food. We both work so much and have pretty much opposite schedules so getting a night off - finally - together and able to go out to eat was really exciting especially to a place we talked about for months since we've moved to this side of town. For whatever reason it was completely empty inside around 815 or so except for us and another table and one couple at the bar. I had been dreaming about the Gorgonzola crusted filet for what had seemed forever. We sat at the bar and the bartender was great attentive and friendly. We were served the bread and red sauce upon sitting down and ordered a glass of wine and a beer. My boyfriend ordered a pasta dish that was quite good but I can't remember the name of it and I ordered the filet I mentioned earlier. His came out perfect however my Gorgonzola crusted filet came out with no Gorgonzola instead with a mushroom sauce of some sort and that is probably the one thing I really just cannot handle, mushrooms... so even though I hate doing it I sent it back. When they returned with my "new" steak it was undoubtedly the same just wiped clean and with Gorgonzola cheese on top and not even warm. Needless to say I was just really sad mostly because of how excited I had been for so long leading up to getting to try it. I ate it it was just ok the actual filet itself didn't have much flavor and was a little tougher than I thought a filet should be. To remedy the issue the manager never came to talk to me just sent out a random dessert which unfortunately was wasted on me since I never order dessert I really am not a sweets person.   It seemed like a nice place and there were other good aspects to it. I would definitely consider another visit to see if I caught them on an off day but the fact that they reused my steak without asking if mushrooms were a dislike or if it was an allergy didn't sit well with me. My boyfriends pasta was really good though and all the other reviews on Yelp seem to be consistently great so maybe we'll give it another go later down the road.

1beSKyUg9mmiC31F7Yfl5g.text: I think we have been to every italian restaurant in Charlotte now after visiting Lucianos. We sat at the bar and gad dinner like we usually do. I will start off with the decor etc.  They need to turn down the lights its way to bright in the restaurant but indo like the color scheme and art, just my opinion. Lets move onto the food. They give you bread with red sauce which the sauce was very good so i was excited for the rest of dinner. We ordered the shrimp appetizer.  1st, it took over 20 minutes to get the shrimp appetizer. The shrimp were perfectly cooked but the sauce was not very flavorful the lemon in the sauce overpowered all the other spices.  We ordered the shrimp fradiavlo and ordered it spicy. Again, the shrimp and pasta were perfectly cooked. The sauce was not spicy at all and very bland, no taste what so ever.  Chef needs to look at the recipes and look to add more spices to the sauces. Our search for the perfect Italian restaurant continues.

cNZDJseiq-vltVH3ozELWA.text: I tried to think of some reason as to why I shouldn't give Luciano's 5 stars and, as you can tell, I couldn't think of a single one.   I absolutely love this place. We've lived less than a block away for over a year and finally just ventured over and we're SO happy we did! I like the inside of the restaurant as it's decor is very nice but not stuffy, it feels homey while looking like quite a 'fancy' restaurant - which is hard to accomplish, but they did it.  To start, our servers have always been 100% spot on; Great personalities and great service. Along with our main server, there is plenty of staff to keep our waters and delicious bread filled. We have also never waited long for our meals, no matter how packed it been or what time of night. Managers come by and sometimes there is a band playing. Plenty of people to keep you happy while at Luciano's.   Now for food...holy delicious. Our first time we tried a pasta and one of their chicken specials for entrees and both were a great amount of food, not too much but very filling and both just tasted so good(note: I have been looking everywhere for a chicken marsala as good as my dads and Luciano's is as close as it gets). Tom was really impressed with how many meatballs and mozzarella were in his pasta (apparently other places really skimp).  Another time we went for just appetizers and I'm gonna lay this out because we were amazed. We got the carpaccio and I swear, enough for 6 people and perfectly done. There was plenty to go around for just us two and the aioli and arugula salad on top was great. We also got the calamari which were cooked perfectly and also had the great aioli sauce to compliment it. However, for me, the Holy Grail was their Scallops and Artichoke antipasti (bow your heads for a moment). It was perfect. The scallops were cooked perfectly. The long stem artichokes were tender and so so tasty and perfect. The pancetta, perfect. And...the lemon sauce, perfect. I had to ask for an entire other bread basket just so I get every little bit of that lemon sauce. Amazingly perfect.   Okay, enough about my obsession with the food and scallops. We love this place. They always find us a seat, we always have great service, there is complimentary valet, the vibe is awesome and the prices are surprisingly modest for the quality and amount of food. I can confidently say, this is my favorite Italian and restaurant in Charlotte so far. Check it out.

AtVo8FkIk2ujoZ0Vv0FDTg.text: I went in as a skeptic because I'm such a big fan of Fiamma's, but I found I can love both!  I have to say I like the classy ambiance and decor of Luciano's much better than Fiamma's, and especially love the heavy rich crown moulding and wainscoting, stacked stone fire oven, painted tin ceiling and chandeliers. We also thought the high top large tables were cute and looked forward to sitting there for dinner.  I can only speak to lunchtime Luciano's experiences, but both were positive! George R. did a great job describing the menu.  The bread was delicious and the sundried tomato pesto was a nice change.    The lunch deals are a steal. Somehow I missed them the first time I went so I ordered eggplant parmesan which was delicious and I loved that the eggplant wasn't individually fried, therefore making it more fatty than necessary. It had a heavy layer of mozz/parm on top of the eggplant so you could easily push it to the side and make it light/healthy. My buddy got the salmon which he really liked but it looked a tad overcooked for my liking.   The next time I got a lunch combo, which was half a Misto salad and a HUGE plate of tomato basil gnocchi. I liked the sauce a lot it came in and generally the gnocchi was good though definitely were soggy/soft and lacked the crisp on the outside. There are few places that get gnocchi right in town... But what made it better is that the combo was only $7.95. Seriously- that's Noodles & Co pricing for amazing ambiance! And I had leftovers!   My hubby got the lunch deal where you get a soup or salad, entree and dessert for $12.95 which was the deal of the century. He had a tomato bisque which was lovely, then there were several entree choices- he picked the penne with italian sausage and spinach which was great. That was filling enough, but then the piece de resistance was the tiramisu which was traditional style with plenty of coffee flavor, and substantial but not too rich.    Bottom line: Nice ambiance, good food, good value. We'll be back.  Side note: this would be a lovely place for a private event like an office dinner or something- I bet you could rent out the enclosed patio.

sKZ_kT5w7x8Dj5GrLZaxRg.text: Honestly the best Italian food I have had in a very long time! This will be our new go to Italian restaurant. My father was in town from New York and he was craving some Italian and this hit the spot from the service to the food everything was completely on point! We will be returning with out a doubt!

6DEvpPM9ptuX9SwGjsTHjg.text: Made our Anniversary. The service and the staff are excellent! Not to mention the food! Never been to Italy.. But after eating here... I feel like im fluent in Italian!! Thanks for making feel at home!

mhaJCC_7kgajqXY8eeSacA.text: My wife and I were nearby and came here on the good reviews. We are coming back again tonight. The atmosphere is fantastic, the food is amazing.

qSM_HadtKKFRSVZ1u0jdUA.text: It was not as casual as it reads in the reviews (they even have optional valet parking). The ambiance was a elegant and the prices were just a bit above moderate (entrees about $20) but the portions were also a bit generous. The staff was really friendly and funny. Overall the food and the experience was good.

PJz_Ryzs4HOol9JBaObBoQ.text: I think this is the best restaurant in town, the food and service is amazing.  The carpaccio appetizer is phenomenal.  The salmon oregannato is also out of this world.  You owe it to yourself to check this place out. If you can sit out on the patio it's worth it, the seats are super comfy.

vtEFx4fiv6SA85eb-mkhpw.text: We ate there yesterday with a party or 6. The place was fabulous! Every dish was fresh, perfectly prepared, and well presented. Service was spectacular with several wait staff attending to us as needed. Beverages never went empty as each course was timed perfectly. From the $7.95 lunch special to the full portion scallops and artichokes, every bite was a delight to the palette. You've got to try the Goat Cheese Pomodoro for an appetizer - if you can put down the fresh bread with sun dried tomato sauce that comes with every meal. For desert, oh my..... we tried the Tiramisu, Molten Chocolate Cake, and the Zeppole (Ricota Cheese Filled Italian Doughnuts). Whatever you do, don't leave without the Zeppole. No way you can eat them all, but just one will send your taste buds to Heaven. Prices by the way, were very reasonable for this quality of food. You won't beat this place for Italian anywhere in Charlotte, not for any amount of money. We will be returning very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Great Wine Selection too!

mwqYy84eB_dTHfxm7mAF8w.text: I have been to Luciano's several times, and must give them 5 stars due to the impeccable service and consistently delicious meals that come out. Last night I was here for Valentine's dinner and ordered the chicken piccata. It was hands-down exactly what I was hoping for and so tasty. We ordered strawberry shortcake for dessert, and it was perfect. Light, fluffy, and topped with a couple strawberries. A manager came around to make sure everything was great. When our server brought our bill, he informed us dessert was on the house--THEN brought us 2 chocolate covered strawberries to end the night! It was great. I recommend sitting in the sunroom area at the window.

zNNPHwi6ZWxYkSd-18jN0A.text: Staff was incredibly nice & helpful. Food came out fast & was delicious!! Atmosphere very nice & upscale ambiance. Def a new favorite and we will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken piccata
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Black spaghetti del mar

_qaCpQkJ-JG7UjFqXu0KxQ.text: Delicious!  The complementary red sauce is amazing.  I've been for brunch, lunch and dinner.  Very solid.

vI0dQaPskoujI7ySZwsf8A.text: 4.5 Stars for me.   It is so challenging to find a good italian restaurant in the Charlotte area. We got drinks (very fresh) and an appetizer (the calamari was excellent). I got the flat bread pizza with fresh mozzarella and basil. My husband got the chicken parm which was delicious. It should be noted that he is Italian so his family makes chicken parm all the time and he said this one was the best restaurant version he's ever had. We were both too stuffed to try dessert but will definitely try that next time.   The service was great we had one waiter who took our order then another who kept our drinks filled. Also of note we went on a Friday night a little before the dinner rush (7 pm) as we had other plans for later. Overall a great experience and we will definitely be back.

dH-wfu4NWO9FwbDS7oiL3g.text: Amazing food and amazing service! Went for lunch and ordered a Cobb salad and a few pizzas for the family. Everything was fantastic! Highly recommend!

cuSFr85WPOOcs1XQbqNOLA.text: This is Luciano's second location with the first one being in Duluth.  The food was very fresh and tasty, the service was very good, and the decor is nice.  It is a little pricey and even with a $25 discount our bill was a little steep for what we got.  I had the special spinach stuffed tortellini with shrimp in vodka sauce.  It was good but not worth the $24 price tag.  The gelato and cappuccino were authentic, especially the latter.   It was real Italian style and not the steamed kind like you get in American coffee shops.  Others have raved about the chopped salad but it was just iceberg lettuce in oil, something I can do for about 50 cents at home and easily.

CKaw0lsZbO6kX4Tmn4bEow.text: This place is awesome. I'm from California and I came here for my birthday dinner and everything was spectacular. We had the Sol and the seafood linguine! It was amazing. Then we ordered a strawberry shortcake and it was awesome!! The whipped cream was to die for!! I completely recommend this place!!

tvpB9P5E8mRob5wD5u51_w.text: If I were to design a restaurant it would look something like this. It looks incredibly gorgeous while managing to stay comfortable and relaxing versus that "too trendy" look many places are going for these days. In the center of it is all is a cozy wood fired stove...  They work in teams here and are VERY attentive. So if you're put off by literally being taken care of while dining, this may not be your place. I for one, was very impressed and it truly felt like everyone was in it together to make my experience unique and wonderful. The service is what takes it over the top to a five star review.   The food was really flavorful, it's Italian with a twist. The crusty bread served with a sundried tomato dip was something I've never had before and something I must have again, It was awesome! I went with the ravioli which was very heavy but the sauce did taste good. I like my pasta rolled out a tad bit thinner but that is me being nit-picky. I was in love with my fiances lasagna (deconstructed)-so I might go that route next time. If you're a cheese fan (as I am) they do not skimp.   Most of the dishes are in the $15-20, drinks in $7-12 range ...they do serve a brunch on Sunday with bottomless cocktail options ( I believe they said sangria, bloody mary's, and mimosas). Can't wait to try brunch next!

qD6EFB1TjrIzPtzEUnZCSw.text: Our meal was absolutely over the top wonderful! The service was attentive and my sons enjoyed the immediate re-fills of their sodas. We were seated on the outdoor room with gorgeous chandeliers.  The interior area looks beautiful too with a lovely tin ceiling and warm feeling. We'll look forward to being seated there during our next visit.  I ordered the Chilean Sea Bass and it was delicious. My fish was perfectly cooked nad served on a bed of cooked greens which I happily devoured once I tasted them. I am not a cooked greens lover, so this was extra-ordinary!   My sons both enjoyed their meals and my husband was thrilled when the chef prepared some mushroom risotto especially for him. It was not on the menu that evening, and when my husband mentioned how much he had looked forward to having it again (he's dined at Luciano's twice in the recent past) the server made sure he had some!    We all decided we would definitely return very soon!

UbVXzA877HAVPoZtn75U9Q.text: Oh Luciano, you have made a place in my heart with your service and food and all gopd things you offered me on my first visit. If ever I have tasted a very delicious ravioli in my life, it is right here at Luciano's!!!! It is omg finger licking delicious.   The staff is so accomodating and nice, i was impressed. My reservation didn't show up in their system for some odd reason but they setup a table for us without a frown. That shows me great customer service right there. Our server was so warm, friendly and great which added to the great experience we had. My mushroom ravioli was the star for me. The cheque was a lil heavy on the wallet but it is a fine dining restaurant and with great service so we didn't mind. You have my heart, Luciano! Love ya

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Most favorite mushroom ravioli

0EKLMfp6X-6CuZND8tOBvw.text: I held my birthday dinner here and they were very accommodating to securing a reservation for a large party on short notice. We ordered a couple of calamari appetizers and they were gobbled up quickly. My gnocchi w/ chicken was absolutely delicious. I tried my friend's risotto and steak - both were good. Everyone's drinks were good as well. My birthday tiramisu dessert was divine.   The manager, I believe, was gracious to capture a couple of photos for us. Very kind.   The cons:   Though attentive, our waitress tended to insert her body & reach over people's food and drinks a lot. Asking someone to pass something to her would've been appropriate.   A member of our party became very ill after dinner and was sick with food poisoning symptoms for several days. Disclaimer: It wasn't confirmed that he indeed had food poisoning.   The bar was playing Django on the tv, of all things. We were all very confused and uncomfortable with it. Odd choice of entertainment.   Overall:  I enjoyed my birthday dinner and would definitely return to this restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tuscan Burrata
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Delmonico Rib Eye w/ risotto

Gl7cyhVP0bL4IRLuhOESiw.text: Party of 6 of us. We ordered wine and a Margherita Pizza (cut as an appetizer). The pizza crust was thicker than the Margherita pizzas in Italy, but the flavor was spot on. I ordered the Fettuccini Carbonara (with a bonus meatball as a personal touch), and a wedge salad. The blue cheese on the salad was bold and tasty, loved it. Actually asked for some extra blue cheese because it was so delicious. The Carbonara was one of the best I have had. Homemade pasta with thick cream sauce, bacon, peas. Excellent entree. The meatball, made with beef, pork and veal was OK. I like meatballs, so I thought I would try one anyway. Our waiter was quiet but efficient. Although he messed up our initial drink order, he and the manager comped our group some dessert at the end of our meal (tiramisu and cheesecake). Overall, great dinner. If in Charlotte, you need to dine here!

g6jnTM9_kbCaePq90cwFFw.text: I came here for a couple of occasions, so I'm going to sum it all up into one review. One was just for a random dinner, another was for mother's day. And two of those experiences combined sort took it down a notch as far as how I liked it. I think the dishes that I ordered were not bad, but to be honest, I don't see myself coming back unless I'm overruled by the family.   I initially would have been a 4 star review, but because of the second time around it changed my mind about it. Why? It's because what we were served during our second time when we decided to try out their seafood. Let's just say the shell fish wasn't so fresh. Anyways, other than that the food here was pretty much the same.   We ordered a bunch of different types of dishes. (Look at the photos) and you can see what we all ordered. I tried the brick chicken as well as the pizza for the second time. Both of the dishes were alright, and not really anything exciting. It was cooked well and the chicken was okay, but I think it was a little dry.  There's nothing that pushes this place over the top compared to other Italian restaurants. But, the seafood that was just a little bit old and has a funky smell to it while being charged for it was a little upsetting to me. It was offered to take it off the bill, but it was already paid by the time that happened. We usually don't say anything, but this was a little bit too much. We enjoyed our time here and it's a great atmosphere and amazing service, but it's just alright in my book for Italian food.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States

Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States

WND5WPGv1z-AwmrSc7uysA.text: This was my first time here. Being connected to a parking garage is great. The lighting is too dark IMO; reminds me of the Cheesecake Factory. I understand trying to set an ambiance, but I wanna see my food when I'm eating. Be prepared to not have any internet connection. We asked the server for the WiFi info.   I really hate that I forgot servers name, but she was AMAZING. We had a rather large party (10+) and she served us all by herself!   I ordered the chicken parm and baked goat cheese pomodoro. I had looked at the menu beforehand and went in with the mindset that I would order the eggplant parm, but it wasn't available. Others in my party wanted that as well; we were pretty disappointed.   The baked goat cheese pomodoro was decent. It basically reminded me of a thick tomato soup but the goat cheese made it better. The chicken parm was delicious. I would definitely order it again. If you're a saucy person like me, I would suggest getting some extra sauce on the side. I feel that If I didn't, it would've been a little dry.

Z5gozFm51UEpYXTZgq_PxA.text: normally I wouldn't go on a Wednesday night for restaurant week. But we had some extra time. I've been here for lunch one time before and it was delicious. Tonight it was exceptional We had the fillet as well as the red snapper which was amazing. The bread that they serve with dinner was delicious and crusty. Also our server Sebastian, which is probably his wrong name was really exceptional It was a beautiful night We sit outside nice breeze. The restaurant was beautiful We will come back soon. Thank you for a great experience.

AdfxB8JtaF_bwUzmtTQ9xA.text: Very good food and prompt service. I had the chicken parmigiana and it was a filling meal. Very reasonable priced too. I'll be back. Two thumbs up!

_k3QFpD_AC3-pm_Ij8usvg.text: What a great experience at Luciano's! My whole family surprised me here after I got engaged. The restaurant was very accommodating to our needs and patient with us as we ordered. The food was delicious. I got the chicken piccata and we shared the burrata and the goat cheese appetizer with the table. It was all very tasty and came out hot. Multiple servers helped out with our big party and it was very helpful. The restaurant is big enough to host larger parties and is accommodating to that as well.  Thank you Luciano's for being great hosts to my family and for giving us a night to remember.

DfSBI1_u-RXMzpUSq9CPKQ.text: I came to this place on a weeknight because I love Italian food and had been wanting to try it for a long time. They were not busy at all around 7 PM, which was a little concerning I guess. You would think they would have more business at that hour. The waiter was very prompt and attentive.   I shared two appetizers with my friend and we also ordered a special to split as the entree. The appetizers were a good size and we left feeling full. They also serve bread, which was pretty delicious- (who doesn't love bread?!). The entree for the night was ok. I would definitely choose something different next time. The marinara sauce was decent, so maybe a dish with that or meatballs.

g5BdaamwzlzoCoIe900VAA.text: I wished I ordered something else since the Rigatoni Salsiccia tasted like it came from a fast food Italian place. The sauce and the sausage tasted like it was supposed to be the ingredients for the pizza. The sauce was described as spicy, but I didn't taste or feel any hint of heat. And the pasta were a bit undercooked? If the fresh mozzarella was a bit warmer/heated, it would have made the dish a bit better.   Most of my table were happy with their food. I had a taste of the Chicken under the Brick. That was a good choice. Plus the mashed potatoes were perfectly garlicky. The toasted garlic bread was worth the extra price instead of just getting the regular table bread.  I do appreciate the great service. For people who carry purses or bags, you can request a purse stand so you don't have to awkwardly hang it on the chairs or place it on the floor. The to-go bag was not a regular plastic bag, but it was a reusuable bag!

DVjn4SJu12Xz7cbRN7zNKg.text: Ate dinner here last Friday (6/28), and it's probably closer to 3.5 stars, but I'm a tough grader. This restaurant is not for everyone. The service is slow - but I like not being rushed. The service is also good - very friendly waiter and the manager came by to check on us.  The food is somewhat hit or miss. We started with the fried calamari, which is exactly like every other calamari appetizer you've ever had, anywhere. Super bland. But, I guess, shame on me for ordering the calamari when I knew better.   I then had the Gorgonzola wedge salad, which is also exactly like most other wedge salads, but delicious.   For the entree, my wife had pork and mashed potatoes, which was excellent. I had the chicken parm, which was (again) your basic chicken parm in style, but awful in execution. The capellini that accompanies was dry and small in portion, with a bland tomato sauce - looked like it had been sitting around. The chicken breast tasted like something that came out of a box. Truly, I've made much better at home and had much better at an Olive Garden style restaurant. So that was a bummer.   The cocktails were a tad watery. I'm no fan of the bars with a light pour, and this is one of them.   Overall, I liked it here. Surprisingly, there are not many great Italian restaurants in town, and this is not one of them. But it's a very good one worth checking out. It was a little slow for a Friday night - doubtless because some of the menu is a bit poorly executed and the drinks are a little weak - but I'm rooting for this place to continue to stick around, and will be back.

pWQ5c4S11_zH8Ib9W_Gwmw.text: Pizza was not edible!! Literally threw it out!  Goat cheese appetizer was okay and spaghetti & meatballs was mediocre enough to eat.   Probably better if you keep looking.

Zbv3lyMpWcRLB0x16Q5r2A.text: I cant even express how much I love this place! We go here for my birthday and anniversaries all the time. The ambiance is romantic I suggest seating on the outside patio (its closed in) Everything I've ever had on the menu was absolutely outstanding and I've basically tried the entire menu. The Lamb chops superb, the veal meatballs had a beautiful sauce textured perfectly. The Veal piccata was done to blissful perfection with the light lemon sauce.Of course you have to get the zeppolis to top it off that's fried pizza dough with nutella in the middle and powdered sugar sprinkled on top! The entire experience is always straordinario

MMP6HVrMHz-5A-fuCYkFIA.text: Well this Italian specialty was worth the wait.  I've had them on my list for a long time and just ended up stopping in on a crazy rainy day.  I called my order in and the host told me where to park when I got there.  I ordered the lasagna, which also came with several pieces of warm soft and chewy bread and some type of oil and tomato sauce.  You already know how much I love fresh pasta so imagine my face as I sampled my food.........so amazing, so fresh, so rich and flavorful!  I would recommend bringing your appetite to this place, my to go order was very filling and I couldn't finish it all.   I definitely will return to try other entrees,  but it will be hard to pass on their lasagna.  It also appeared to be a nice location for a special occasion dinner.  They also give you the takeout order in their own recyclable bag, sweet!

0sJEJg9n_Puj2ID1A7jRxA.text: We had dinner at Luciano's on a Monday evening. The restaurant was pretty dead, so we were easily able to get a table.   For our entrees we ordered the chicken piccata and the chicken parmigiana. We also ordered a Caesar salad and a wedge salad to start. The wedge salad was by far the better of the 2 salads. They also brought out bread and a delicious dipping sauce!   I loved my chicken parmigiana, and it was HUGE. Plenty to share for at least 2 people. My fiance also really enjoyed his chicken piccata.   We did not try the dessert because we were too full, but they looked delicious!! We will definitely return to this place!

ybFVcGjA14HMbNh88WTqrQ.text: We had a delicious meal here for my husbands birthday.  We started with the meatballs which were very tender and tasty.  My husband had the lasagna coco, which is a deconstructed lasagna.  It was very rich and cheesy.  I had the tomato basil Fettuccine with shrimp.  Also delicious.  There was a lot of food.  Neither of us could finish our dinners.

rUYNW6iqf0JBArsTt8swVA.text: I got there around eight and the place was pretty  empty and my order  was taken right away which was very nice.   After I ordered my dinner, anytime I needed something I had to reach out to staff.  The pasta was OK I got the cappellini Bolognese.

GZphxUueiIykghmurOUf8g.text: We had a good dining experience. I had the chicken piccata with spinach, and it was filling. Mckayla, our waitress, was very efficient, courteous, and professional.

h3naVUlWW9Q2-Tv_eduWsQ.text: Food was good but because we had it delivered it was cold by the time it got to us. Pizza would've been delicious had it been hot and fresh. The garlic bread and salads were very good. Would definitely try to eat in the restaurant next time we're in town.

cVUlfDPNnF4LcFzlyc7rpg.text: Holy guacamole! (Spoiler alert: this place does not serve guacamole) This restaurant is so cute! And I only went to pickup my food! This definitely seems like a great date spot. I ordered the veal meatballs and the carbonara. The carbonara was super rich and I could barely eat half of it- more bang for my buck! The meatballs were delicious but you only get 3. I'll be back to try out the rest of the menu!

CyL62Dv1P1QZnsfj8NXXCA.text: Luciano's was excellent from the atmosphere to the decor to, of course, the food.  I had the caprese salad and the almond crusted halibut with a delicious saffron sauce and she had the braised beef agnolotti.  I will definitely visit again and I look forward to trying out some of their more traditional dishes as well.

s782m5lm7I8P-sldLzup0A.text: I went to this small but elegant restaurant as part of a Meet Up group last night.  They had valet parking right outside which was convenient for a rainy evening.  We were seated and offered water. The host also brought out this standing device that had hooks to hold our purses!  I thought that was neat.  Our drink orders were taken fairly soon.  Our small group arrived in stages, so I think that is why our server didn't ask us if we were ready to order.  We were finally given bread and this wonderful tomato/garlic/olive oil sauce.  This brought happiness to this very hungry gal!  I could have eaten that whole basket of bread, but I restrained myself in a lady like fashion to only eating two small pieces.  I was craving Fettucine Alfredo, so I ordered it.  I also ordered the chopped salad with blue cheese dressing.  It was only $4.50 with an entree.  But, when it arrived, it was massive!  It also came with extra blue cheese.  Not wanting to spoil my appetite for the main event, I regulated myself to eating half.  The server boxed up the rest for me.   The Fettucine Alfredo itself was ok.  It lacked richness as if it was made with milk instead of with cream.  Also, a hint of nutmeg would have been nice. It took awhile for food to arrive, but the happy, friendly attitude of the staff made up for it.   I could have made a meal off of the bread and salad alone.  Maybe that is what I will do next time I return.

uuL9ZL8dNKtimOzBhOtxng.text: The service was prompt, the meals were delicious, and the lunch courses were an absolutely spectacular value! Overall, extremely happy and would definitely recommend to everyone!!

tlU3AgCltDM3yk7EF4iSFQ.text: In my opinion one of the best Italian restaurants in Charlotte (and I have been to quite a few). My husband and I try and make it there once a month.  Great service and a friendly staff. I love their patio. It is a great place to have some apps and a bottle of wine. I recommend their antipasto plate and the beef Carpaccio for appetizers. Their capellini bolognese is one of the better ones I have had.   I think they need to do a better job of advertising that they are there because this is one of those places that should ALWAYS be packed!!

6HARK_Q_o9wL3iREZxoLLw.text: I will definitely be returning to Luciano's! I loved the ambiance, antipasti board and the service.

5tGelAkALho3VDce2x901w.text: I really can't find any objection to my recent trip to Luciano's. I ordered a flounder dish which is new on the menu. Another dish had English peas which I love. I asked that they be added and the chef was happy to do so. Wine by the glass was very good and the service at the bar was attentive. Luciano's is a really good restaurant- I need to go more often.

VIplwv_aMEXCtwYBshzToA.text: I love Italian so much ... I married one.  Place was great, and I look forward to my next visit

O-rMtdfz-rqjTVEPRbRYxQ.text: Excellent service and food. We sat on the patio and it was very well shaded even with the summer heat. Server was knowledgeable of the menu and wine list. We had the scallop crudo and several different entrees. Everyone was pleased with their selection - did have to send back salmon as it was very undercooked. Bread pudding for dessert was a great finale to the dinner. I would go back and I recommend this restaurant. (Chose the exterior for seating because the inside was frigid).

0zUp9g0Lk_DsEDC2O7oSkA.text: Food was a 10 outta 10.  The same goes for the service.  We are NJ transplants and can easily state this restaurant is as good if not better. Will definitely be back over and over.

cIX6vKH4HFoA0vTRDsHpNg.text: Update:1/13/16 - Our same group went back again.  The food was just as good as last time, but I am adding a star for the service. We had a great time.  Chelsea was really amazing.  She made the dinner truly enjoyable.    A group of us went there for a work dinner a few nights ago.  The appetizers were great.  We enjoyed the wine and atmosphere.  The only issue was the scallops were slightly over cooked.  Would definitely recommend this place to anyone.

gF4nt-m4brH4ipis-Hx6qg.text: Fantastic lunch special---of pumpkin ravioli with brown butter sauce, wedge salad and tiramisu dessert!! Love this Italian food.

2LKL79A9JTdlionQZ4LcuQ.text: We have been searching for good Italian in Charlotte as my husband is from a very large Italian family. We tried this place for date night and were pleasantly surprised.   My husband got the shrimp fra diavolo which was deliciously spicy and creamy. He was very happy with the flavors and pasta quality.   I ordered the special which was a seafood ravioli jam packed with multiple types of seafood with a great cream sauce over top.   The first time we tried this place the Marsala was mediocre and calamari over cooked but I am glad we gave it another shot, round two was a delicious meal!

o3cp77XBnLY8bn3AskuGtQ.text: LOVE the atmosphere of this place. The bread and sun dried tomato dip was outstanding. We had the halibut with risotto and chard for our meals and it was really, really good. Can't wait to come back!!

HTH5uoWyxj7nIqtgFu-9IA.text: As far as Italian food goes, Luciano's is definitely one of Charlotte's top places to go! The restaurant is in the space that La Paz used to occupy.  It's absolutely gorgeous inside. The ambience is elegant, modern, but with traditional touches that prevent it from being overly trendy.  You feel classy and comfortable at the same time which I really like!  The service we had was great.  Quick to bring you water and drinks.  Wednesday is half-priced bottles which explains my mini headache as I type this on Thursday morning.  Instead of your typical olive oil, they bring out delicious crusty bread with sundried tomato and parmesan dip/spread. It is incredibly delicious. We split the wood grilled octopus as an appetizer.  It's served over a crushed chickpea mixture.  It was a unique and delectable combination.   As my entree I ordered the zuppa di mare (seafood soup).  An incredibly flavorful tomato based broth FULL of calamari, shrimp, scallops and mussels.  It's a very generous portion.  I am really looking forward to eating my leftovers.  I can't recommend Luciano's enough. I can't wait to return!

6dvFEu29oDgw_2uyowGx0A.text: Lovely restaurant . Great service . The pomodoro cheese dish is great to own with . I took the salmon salad with a tasty sweet balsamic   Italian music in the background and very professional service . Also have wifi.

skI7zUjyWVEJN8YImoy3bQ.text: Went to Luciano's back in January with a colleague. Fairly nice and upscale restaurant, very friendly waitstaff and great food! If I find myself in the area again, I will be sure to visit again!

MbmBnxCnu9t-mShHOJmlVA.text: This is once, again, why I will NEVER recommend your restaurant. It had been over 2 months and no one has made good on "making up" my terrible experience as written under my first yelp review. Unless it's a refund, I will never step foot in your establishment and will make sure no one else I encounter does.

uDuPFjotDk1zr-juR0XhKA.text: Luchiano's is our go to for special occasions... But, tonight was a huge disappointment! We had to wait 20 minutes until a server asked us for drinks and this was only after we had approached the management about why there was a delay. There was not even an explanation about why the delay occurred. The manager was nice about it and comped our drinks. Subsequently, the waiter that ended up taking our order seemed to be put out. The food we got was angel hair pasta and it was clumped together, as if it were old and reheated or something. As I said earlier, this was very disappointing.  Especially since it was our anniversary celebration and we had made arrangements for a babysitter to enjoy a special evening. Over the past four years we have generally had very good experiences. It seems as though there may be some issues that have crept in over the past few months as we are seeing others with similar experiences on yelp.

5fcbQ8pa7_WgyRI9D3WdpQ.text: The Chicken Parm was probably the best I've had in Charlotte. I absolutely love a good "free" appetizer -- and the bread and marinara sauce that they bring out is to die for. Absolutely recommend.

2f7yBskyDust3clrDdbhPg.text: There's two parts to this review, really. The first part is food, the second is the parking/valet experience.   Food: 4/5 stars  Great. Very nicely done and tasteful. The bread w/ sun dried tomato is a nice change of pace. Both entrees were excellent, hot and cooked well. The service was superb, very nice and polite and never left wondering where they ran off to.   Parking/Valet: 1/5 stars  If you're coming here for dinner, just go ahead and bank on using the valet. The self parking deck is tight, small, and only 1 way up, 1 way down. If you get to the top and there are no spots, you've got to awkwardly turn around at the top in a tiny space.   The valet... Oh my the valet. I drive a manual car, which is admittedly a dying breed. But with a valet, they should be able to at the very least park it. THIS IS NOT THE CASE AT THIS LOCATION. The gentlemen that picked my car up when we arrived stalled right away. He started the car again and lurched his way to a parking spot. The same thing happened when another gentlemen delivered the car back to us.   2 valet people, both stalled and lurched the car the whole way. This place isn't worth my time and risking not getting my car back in one piece.

pPaS0i74q6TzzrF8KHFt6Q.text: This place is amazing! I took my fiance here for her 25th birthday dinner. We had the black spaghetti and shrimp Frad viola. Both were just enough to fill us up. The atmosphere here is so calming and elegant. There was a musician singing, mostly Sinatra. Even though the place was packed, we felt like we were the only couple in the restaurant. The server, Ronald, was very attentive and gave us a great experience. I will be back again and again.

CwqvEmTp6mGOTUjH_0kfrg.text: The ambience is good.  I ordered the John's steak and eggs for brunch.  It's delicious.

eDIqePMLLlJ7DS0IpeAiFg.text: The atmosphere of this place has been totally transformed and opened up from what it was as La Paz. It is hard to imagine that it is even the same space. Elegant, but not too stuffy. I liked it.  The food was simply incredible. I mean really, really incredible. I have eaten at so many Italian joints, from kitschy to stuffy to authentic to unknown neighborhood spots to chain restaurants. But this place really takes the cake. Everything we had was phenomenal. Nothing even just "OK." We had the wood grilled octopus and goat cheese pomodoro. Both should not be missed, but the goat cheese was just ridiculously delicious. I had a wedge salad and my wife had a Caprese salad...both very near perfection. I had the Zuppa di mare, or seafood stew, and it was packed with calamari, scallops, mussels, clams, shrimp, and white fish. I can't begin to tell you how much i enjoyed it. My wife had the Gorgonzola beef filet. She said it was only second to Del Frisco's, which is quite a compliment, especially for a non-steakhouse. We finished with a Nutella custard and Nutella filled doughnuts. God, it was so good.  The service was something I would expect at a much more expensive restaurant. Our server, Christopher, addressed every need and was just the right amount of cordial and friendly with us.  Prices were very reasonable...especially for the quality. Most entrees were $15-$20 and topped out at $33.   Literally zero complaints from this place. Just a perfect evening we had there. I am hoping that it wasn't  If they can keep up this service and quality of food, they are going to give Luce, Toscana, Villa Antonio, etc. a run for their money.  Edit: We went back for Mother's Day tonight with my mother and mother in law. Again, service and food were superb. Everyone enjoyed everything. We left in a bit of a food coma, but it was well worth it. Christopher was our server once again upon request, and his service was exceptional again. He remembered us and made us feel at home with our moms. This is just a really great spot...love it!

XIKABfExw5gWo9PIH8qgiA.text: Visiting Charlotte and chose this location based on other Yelp reviews. We were not disappointed. Seated on time, excellent staff, food was quite good. Had the nightly special of seared scallops over mushroom risotto - perfection. Also had eggplant Parmesan, also quite good. Will definitely visit this location again when in Charlotte.

5SN1GnjulaAqWTkwTkTI6Q.text: Dinner for 8 on Sat night.  Service was very good. They accommodated split checks including the bottles of wine.  The food was considered good by all. Entrees of brick chicken, veal, and pastas.  All good. Nice to have an Italian restaurant that's not a chain.  Will go back and would recommend.

alh-Gq3etCaifbOvk3C4hg.text: I found Luciano's a very pleasant and attentive restaurant. The decor is equal to the food presentation. Having moved to Charlotte several years ago from NYC, I am a little fussy about food (especially Italian food). The waiter (a former New Yorker) was knowledgeable, honest, and very helpful. Management came by to chat and inquire about our experience. The food quality was equal to the presentation. I will be back again soon and I recommend the restaurant without reservation. (no pun intended).

-rSN3BG3bEWk12dJW4z0og.text: One of the best meals I've had in Charlotte.   Everything from the service, wine, salad, entree, and to dessert was great!   We will be back again very soon!

ErhNFLB1KLRRalJzao69Qw.text: My girlfriends and I went to Lucianos for a birthday celebration.  The ambiance was elegant and yet very relaxing. The wait staff was top notch. The food beginning with Basil Tomato Bisque and calamari for starters which was delicious and timely.  The entrees chosen were lasagna and bbq chicken pizza both were perfection. The staff and owner were very friendly and engaging. We will definitely go back again. Can't wait to bring my husband.

s_3lg3AAKS0PJ12m5JF_FA.text: My in-laws were in town last week so we went here for lunch...and then came back for dinner!  Each meal was fabulous.  The wait staff was attentive and the environment was beautiful.  We'll definitely be back.

PGbq3RcsjzW2xPb9GV7oDw.text: Great location, nice ambiance. My Arrabiata was a little disappointing but another person in our party had what was apparently the best dirty martini ever. The wait staff needed to improve, though. The waitress disappeared for long periods, and every round of food served was served to the wrong person.  I will give it another try.

bdwhVbJnYMyHSG1H6x6pcw.text: This was our first time there, but it won't be the last even though it is quite the drive for us. It was worth it.  We went for Restaurant Week, but only 2 of 6 ordered off that menu, the rest off the main.  I had the chicken Luciano and it was really good. Just needed a tiny bit more sauce. My wife had the salmon dish and she thought it was solid.  We took my niece and her boyfriend and they had the lobster ravioli and the fettuccine Alfredo respectively.  Kids had "the best spaghetti and meatballs " and a pretty good pepperoni pizza. My niece's very Italian boyfriend thought his fettuccine was almost as good as "mom's". Their bread was delicious and they had pureed sun dried tomatoes for a dipping sauce. Mmmmm.  Dessert was bread pudding - 5 stars.  Others had raspberry sorbet, cannoli, chocolate cream pie and zeppeles with Nutella. All good.  There were a ton of good looking things on the main menu that I can't wait to get back to try.  We went in with no expectations and came out so pleasantly surprised.

cbhLYQkBA6WIjM3beJol3Q.text: The menu looked great and I was wondering if the food would match up and it did.  Everything was wonderful, the server made great recommendations and the atmosphere was very nice.  It doesnt feel like your typical cozy Italian restaurant its more modern and upscale looking.  I will be back for sure.

cIZBsxs0n2yra2v9EPLn3A.text: had the pleasure of going to this fine restaurant for the second time, both trips we had great food and  like the half price bottles of wine on wednesdays, had  the chance to taste a more expensive bottle for a good price, my next visit to charlotte i  will be back

gz2eYLkPQiu7ploeAu6oWw.text: This place was great. We took my in-laws there and everyone's food was amazing. It was all served piping hot and the waitress was great. I will surely be back.

UQluC9kLNCjat3aUw1emCA.text: Italian is not my first choice when going out for dinner but I heard great things about this place and recommended it for our girls' night out. The bread and sun dried tomato dip was an excellent way to start the meal. I don't typically like sun dried tomatoes but this dip was warm and almost tasted meaty. I mentioned to my friends that I could have an entire basket of bread and dip for dinner and I would be completely satisfied. They agreed. We all ordered the special of the night which was bass and risotto with mushrooms. When it came out, it was gnocchi, which was completely fine with me since I had been craving gnocchi but don't usually order it since it quickly fills me up. The fish was cooked perfectly, a little crispy skin and yummy mushroom sauce. Just as I expected, I ate all the gnocchi and couldn't finish my fish. The desserts looked excellent but I couldn't wait to get home and put on my yoga pants so I could breathe. I will be back.

CTsIcKf9KINv3bfijxSK6w.text: Went here for Mother's Day.  I made a reservation a month ahead and there was no mention of the $45 buffet.  The buffet was lacking for $45.  I did not think most of the food had flavor.  There was not a lot of service since it was a buffet.  Other places that had Mother's Day brunch had a 3 course menu to choose from.  I guess they went with the buffet to get you in and get you out quickly.  It was definitely not worth the price.

CeKAc03uhI5H8Xfw3KCO7g.text: We heard great things about this restaurant so decided to try it last night. Amazing food and a super attentive wait staff.  They really understood the dishes and will customize. The goat cheese marinara app was the beast.  Luciano's house marinara sauce was the best I've had too. Ambience in the main dining has a great vibe.  We'll be back!  Great restaurant. Great staff! Try it

XgUokCIIX3TGl60cRGRBlw.text: Waitress was pleasant and helpful with menu choices.  Great atmosphere and ambience. Half price wine on Wednesdays is a great deal.   A bit slow with services like fresh ground pepper and grated cheese. Also, seat was broken and cut my finger on it - ouch! Told the manager and he was indifferent.   My chicken parmigiana was okay, a bit dry. Wedge salad was as satisfying, flavorful, and tasty - particularly the well seasoned bacon.   My dinner companions were very pleased with their dishes - eggplant parmigiana and linguini carbonara.

yvqaBxQjO6MLrSb9I09Mwg.text: The best Italian in the city! 5/5  The food is great, the zucchini appetizer is outstanding and the flatbread is too. They have a great selection of entrees, all the times I have been here have been almost prefect!  You can't go wrong with any dessert at this place! The cannoli is the best in the entire city, it is fresh and the filling is very rich. The cheesecake is mostly outstanding too, sometimes the cheesecake hasn't been as good as it could have been, but overall it has been great.   This restaurant has the best Italian in the city!, 2nd place goes to Maggianos which also is perfect 5/5.   If you go here, most definitely get an appetizer and dessert.

KmU0RcVHwtoIV4npqGjWZw.text: From the bread to the salad to the service to the entree, everything in my party was so good! Muah!

S2ibaIQySssQZFK77j9QuA.text: My husband and I came here this past Tuesday night (4/19/16) and we were extremely glad we had picked this place to go to! We went around 9:30PM and decided to sit outside since the weather was so nice. The service staff was extremely nice and helpful. Our server (who also appeared to be the bartender as well) was able to make the best recommendations for both of our entrees. I would have taken pictures, but my phone battery was too low :(   We were served bread and butter to start, and I loved the bread as it was warm, soft and yummy.  The entrees did take a while to come out, but that was my only complaint through the entire night and it was so delicious that it was well worth the wait. My husband ordered their version of a deconstructed lasagna and it was the best lasagna we had ever eaten. I ordered the capellini bolognese and it was also absolutely delicious! Both dishes were extremely flavorful but not overpowering. There was literally nothing that could have been changed to either dish to improve anything about them as they tasted perfectly as they were already! We also tried the strawberry shortcake which was also absolutely amazing!  I really enjoyed being able to sit outside and the atmosphere that was created outside using the candle light was very pleasant and romantic for us since we were celebrating.   Overall, for two drinks and two entrees, we spent about $60 before tip, which was extremely reasonable considering the great experience we had. I would definitely recommend eating here and I also plan to dine here again the next time I visit Charlotte. Thank you to our server and everyone involved in giving us a wonderful birthday dining experience! Please keep up the great work! :)

y6ifDL2qA-U57qilLfvOdg.text: Thought I'd try a pizza from here... $18 for a 12" pepperoni pizza. Biggest mistake was ordering it from Postmates delivery. With delivery fee and driver tip, this child-size pizza cost me $30.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beer can included to show how small this $18 pizza is.

Gxe29vSyWsOkSSNuEC5Ubw.text: So disapointed. I ordered filet..mediunm...the cow was still mooing. I'm with a party of 6.. I sent it back to have them recook it...cameback...still raw and my table was finished eating. I addressed it with the manager Jose and he could care less. He had a terrible attitude.. Our waiter Alberto said...it wasn't his fault. My drinks had no alcohol in them as well. Food sucked...service sucked...ill never go back..i left hungry....

DWsWnvVus4IuJSEEU5PUCg.text: 5 stars to me since it's been a challenge finding exceptional quality food establishments in NC. I know I'm a bit spoiled having lived in Chicago all my life and visited New York a few times for work. There's nothing wrong with having a high standard when it comes to nourishing your body with good food. Can I get an amen?!  So far Luciano's has met my foodie expectations: 1. Ambiance- romantic, classy, yet still good for a family dinner with little ones 2. Decor- modern with traditional accents 3. Service- courteous, attentive, and inviting 4. Food- light but decadent enough to allow those Italian flavors to come through 5. Value- a final bill for a family of six in the amount of $88!!!! It would have been higher if we would have ordered their seafood or angus steak plates. Next time.  Our server Ronald went above and beyond attending to our table. Patient and attentive. He didn't up sell on any dish and pretty much told us we can't go wrong with anything in the menu.   Overall, our plates ranged from individual pizzas, chicken under the oven, Fettuccini Alfredo, and chicken piccata, which we all loved.   The bonus was making our daughters birthday dinner here more special by presenting her with a chocolate brownie with a side of ice cream. It was absolute bliss, according to my daughter. She gave me a bite (very tiny one) and I agree.  Try this place. It's really good.

TXri5BOABxikNsAomHobiw.text: I thought with the fantastic reviews, especially from some Yelpers that I usually have very similar tastes to, that I was going to be wowed and then some by Luciano's.  Well... it was decent, but I felt our meal was one small step above Olive Garden (gasped and clutched my pearls as I typed that).  With a Yelp check-in, you could enjoy 10% off of your meal as of 12/27/15.  The interior space is lovely - the chandeliers on the patio are beautiful.    The food: Menu:  BAKED GOAT CHEESE POMODORO: Baked herbed goat cheese, toasted garlic ciabatta bread. Realness:  A golf ball sized lump of very good goat cheese dropped in a bowl full of pomodoro sauce.  The cheese and bread were quite good, but was not expecting the tomato bath - I should have asked more questions, my bad.  Menu:  WEDGE: Fresh Iceberg, chopped tomatoes, bacon, creamy authentic Parmigiano dressing, and crumbled Gorgonzola cheese Realness:  The iceberg had a very tough core portion that was left on.  Bacon tasted a bit off, dressing and cheese were good.  I really love wedge salads, but was not atwitter over this one.  Menu:  GNOCCHI: Baked with prosciutto di parma, and gorgonzola cream Realness:  Barely any prosciutto (I had 2 small pieces with dinner and 3 small pieces when I had it reheated for lunch the next day).  The gnocchi and sauce were good.  It was better reheated the next day.    I had the strawberry shortcake for dessert and it was light and tasty.    Complimentary bread is served with a plate of tomato sauce for your meal.  Bread was warm and fresh.  The wait staff was excellent and stayed on top of drink refills, though we did need to ask for plates to be removed.  We were at a small 2-top table even though the restaurant was basically empty on the Sunday after Christmas from 6 until 8.  After looking at pictures of the interior, I thought I needed to dress a little better than jeans and a cardigan, but it seems that most of the people there had on jeans, polos, khakis and even a couple of mooks who didn't take their baseball caps off while dining.    They have a separate area for large group dining.    There is valet parking or you can try your luck in the parking garage that is shared with Sullivan's.  The lot is a bit of a cluster, so during peak times, I would use the valet, but we had no trouble on a rainy Sunday night.  For an appetizer, 2 salads, 2 entrees and 2 desserts, the total was just under $80.  My date was absolutely delightful and the setting was lovely, so it was a very nice evening, but it was just A-OK, nothing stood out.

9kcjjN-MceV8hnVJ0FlcKg.text: The food was amazing!! Try the lasagna!! I forgot its name on the menu but it was loaded and very rich in flavor!! Not too salty too. The desert, which was this eggless custard, was so light and creamy!!

4zt3lj4wrQqpDYmShpYCHg.text: Italian food. Great atmosphere.   I was surprised by what they did with this space. The decor elevates it quite a bit. We had lunch here on an off hour, so the place was empty, but still the Caesar with chicken (my lunch go-to) was delish and the service was good.  I can't speak to the pastas and other items yet. I will have to try them sometime. I never eat carbs at lunch time. :)  I think this would be a great place for a date or even a corporate dinner.

Add77x9j4CO9bpCqfUMMjg.text: Luciano's has the splash of five stars with the striking decor, the white clothed tables with sparkling glasses and prompt service.  But once you get the food it is OK, wines and alcohol are very high prices and I understand volumes and measures but, further, spending $14 for a glass of decent wine and being served an inch in a large glass was insulting.  Menu is pretty basic with few special items that you would expect from a five star place, but not here.    Their sun dried tomato olive oil and cheese dip is out of this world, worthy of a spoon or a much larger ration of bread.  It is OK, but too expensive for what you get for your stomach rather than your eyes.

hcqkU4Y57tdARJ6FBVwEvw.text: The atmosphere is classy and welcoming. It is well lit and the outdoor patio has pretty chandeliers. You can see the pizza oven behind the bar and it adds some ambiance to the dining room. The bread and tomato sauce was phenomenal. The tomato sauce had a robust flavor that we couldn't stop eating. The bread with the goat cheese pomodoro is crisp and chewy and once again the tomato sauce was impossible to stop eating. We had a wedge salad, a veggie pizza, and linguine carbonara. The dressing on the wedge salad was super creamy. The veggie pizza was a great mix of veggies and the linguine carbonara did not last long despite how full we were. Great food and atmosphere!

YVFlzOW6ei86_0q2Z6rtGg.text: Service is over the top here. David at the. Bar is excellent! Food is great. Much better service than Sullivan's across the way! Great service !

W7DjtP1m4F65e77Il_O16g.text: Stopped in for a visit after landing at Charlotte airport. Great experience sitting at the bar. Delicious caesar salad, sauteed garlic spinach, and the shrimp fra diavolo. Will definitely return the next time I'm in Charlotte. Loved the sundried tomato sauce served with the fresh bread. Seems like it would be a fun, hip place to visit on the weekends.

LnP2Bp8Gz9GZdCQBrs2UxQ.text: Best Italian food I've had in Charlotte so far. I visited with my girlfriend this week, and the food and service were both phenomenal.  The food: we started with the goat cheese pomodoro. It was a delicious marinara and goat cheese blend with awesome garlic bread - great appetizer. I ordered the rigatoni salsicia and she got the spaghetti & meatballs. Both pasta dishes were excellent, and you could tell the pasta was freshly made egg pasta, rather than dry pasta from a box. The flavors were great in both dishes, and the meatballs were huge and tasty! We chose the triple layer mousse cake for dessert after viewing all the selections, and it was light and delicious. It was a perfect sweet endnote to the meal without being a huge portion of dessert that leaves you stuffed. The service was great as well. Our waiter was attentive, and the busboy/ server assistant helped box our food, take plates, etc. The main sticking point: my girlfriend and I were debating about whether a cherry or strawberry on top would be better on the mousse cake.. so our server brought out ramekins with a few of each for us. It was a small but nice touch to end a great meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese pomodoro
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Goat cheese pomodoro
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. The waiter brought extra cherries and strawberries because we debated over which would be better

CDer5AoU0QH2z_HV97Q_kg.text: Great food - highly recommend the Gorgonzola encrusted filet.  Monday nights is no corkage fee so it's become our go to byob wine club dinner.

AUNeeK4z7j9dg0faxJxKBw.text: Came here for dinner on a early Saturday evening. Made reservations through open table. Very cozy atmosphere. We opted for the fish special and the chicken flatbread pizza. The mozzarella was very fresh on the flatbread and was nicely cooked. The fish special was very good as well. There was a mix up with our entrees and the manager took off the fish special. We kindly asked to place the item back on because the food was delicious and the mix up did not change our experience. I'm not a huge fan of Italian food, but I think the menu has plenty on it if you aren't a big fan of pasta dishes. Only gave four stars because our waitress was a bit lackluster.

WFSIFBy_i7-dPCSuZ5bAhQ.text: Just ok.  Meatballs...Not exciting, then had Fughi flatbread and the vinegar on the onions punched me in the face. I tasted no mushroom or truffle oil

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. I had high hopes for the veal meatballs. Nope!

4xccd-OOJwTqUQ0W_cuPdw.text: Our friends had a wonderful meal here during restaurant week so we were excited to try this place. Unfortunately we did not have as wonderful of an experience. There were four of us all together. The tomato bisque soup was delicious but was lukewarm at best. Two of us had chopped salads which were mediocre in flavor and somewhere the concept of 'chopped' got lost. My lasagne had great flavor but the noodles were clumped together. My husband had the rigatoni with Italian sausage which had good spice to it but the pasta was extremely al dente for our tastes.  Our friend's shrimp fra diavolo was good but lacked any spice to it-it needed a bit more kick. Our other friend's shrimp scampi on risotto had beautiful presentation and I think overall she enjoyed her meal.   The service, too, lacked severely. The restaurant was busy as there were several parties of high schoolers eating there for prom but not all tables were filled so it wasn't crazy busy yet 10-15 minutes would pass without seeing our server. We never received a refill of our bread or water. My husband had to ask a different server to bring him the blue cheese stuffed olives that his martini was served without. We stopped what appeared to be the Maitre d to complain that the martini itself was watered down and he was very rude in his interaction with us. A new martini was made immediately and was much better. I would not consider us to be high maintenance customers but when you don't receive what was ordered or even a spoon to eat your soup with and there are no apologies or friendly, efficient service, it makes for some very aggravated consumers. We will not be returning to this restaurant.

bn_1Ql2HgaPTusmuPQXZ5Q.text: Excellent experience! The food was beyond delicious, the atmosphere is very welcoming and the staff is friendly.  Wasn't rushed and enjoyed the experience. Will be back!

UCxl21y52FCWwTYBiYAAYA.text: Great Italian food. The inside is fancier than what I was expecting but not too formal. We came on a Wednesday and it was half price wine. Not many places you can get delicious authentic Italian food for a reasonable price. The eggplant parm was amazing and my boyfriend ordered the lobster ravioli special. Finish that off with cannolis for dessert. Overall a great meal- would definitely recommend for family dinner/ date night.

sHpER5sX9db3rYEaQBDJ3g.text: Foot and service was very good. Salads were substantial and great home made dressungs. We were glad we tried it and if back in Charlotte it would be one to try again.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bassin

VctiniD-qrehGKQrb69yAw.text: Lunch at Luciano's was absolutely delightful! I met a dear friend for lunch, and we were both extremely pleased with the food and service. Luciano's offers special lunch selections of 3 courses; soup or salad, main dish and dessert.  Our server, Kyle, didn't rush courses and flowed the service as a pro. The sundried tomatoes in olive oil served with bread as a starter (and complimentary) were SO delicious! The bean and sausage soup was rich and scrumptious. The grilled, brick chicken was fabulous with just the perfect blackening at corners of the chicken. And creme brulee to finish was great. I can't wait to return! BTW, I "fine dine" quite often and am extremely critical of food, service and ambiance. A big 10 on all to Luciano's!

S8ueGrMh4AhTeZMq8Rd7eA.text: I'm going to be honest, we had a fabulous meal and service experience at Luciano's, however we did have an "incident" happen to us as dinner that was very unusual and surprising. However, because of the beautiful way it was handled and the incredible understanding and sympathy of not only our waitress but also the manager on duty, I can hands down say that it was a completely honest mistake on the part of the kitchen, something that after our experience would be examined and re-examined so as to never happen again. With that saying, we truly had a, aside from this one incident, an incredible experience and I would visit Luciano's again in a heartbeat. I always forget how much I love Italian food until I have fabulous Italian food, Luciano's reminded me of that love once again (note: my partner in Italian, that is no accident friends!). We were lucky enough to be able to set up a reservation an hour before we wanted to eat online and walked in and were seated right away. Immediately we felt welcomed, by our waitress and the manager, who at the time we didn't even know was the manager. I love that they have a manager on duty that greets each table and brings bread, water, etc., just welcomes people to the restaurant.   The bread is made out-of-house by baked in house and is fantastic, especially when paired with an incredible, somewhat spicy marinara. Funny, my Italian partner makes homemade sauce often, and his favorite thing is to dip fresh bread into the sauce, must be an Italian thing! For entrees we ordered the BBQ Chicken Pizza: Smoked chicken, red onions, avocado, fresh cilantro, and the chicken parmigiana. I honestly couldn't say a negative thing about either dish, they were superb. The pizza would be a good two person meal or appetizer. I loved the new take on BBQ chicken, the avocado, red onion and cilantro complimented it perfectly. It's not often, after having a "bad" experience in a restaurant, that you'd rush to go back. But the food was so fabulous, the service stellar and the situation was handled so graciously, that I will definitely be heading back to Luciano's!

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ Chicken Flatbread: smoked chicken, red onions, avocado, fresh cilantro.

wtf8PDmFzO4CfM1XZEO3cA.text: We went to Luciano's  the other day thinking this place was just a chain restaurant and similar to Carrabba's.  We were definitely wrong.  Luckily our curbed expectations led to a very pleasant surprise. (PS - There is nothing wrong Carrabba's)  The inside of the restaurant is very nice, and feels upscale.  Luckily the prices are not 'upscale' in nature for the food or drinks.  The BIG PLUS here is their SERVICE.  It was exceptional.  Everyone was extremely helpful, friendly, and polite.  The service reminded of something you would see at a very nice steakhouse.  For drinks, we tried the Strawberry Lemon Drop  and the Pometini.  Both were delicious, especially the Strawberry Lemon Drop.  My only tiny gripe is that they could have been stronger, but they were not watered down.  In terms of food, we got plenty of their bread, which was warm and delicious, with some kind of olive oil dipping sauce that had a tomato-y taste to it.  For the entree, we tried their Lasagna Coco Pazzo, which is much different (in a good way) than the traditional Lasagna that you would think of.  Great meat sauce and tons of cheese.  Also, a massive portion, so plan on bringing most of it home, especially if you get after it in the bread department.  For some reason, we decided to get a dessert, despite the mass quantities of food consumed 10 mins earlier.  We got the Zeppole, which are mini cinnamon sugar donuts with nutella and ricotta cheese in them. Very tasty, but I could have gone for some dipping sauces...because...why not.  When we saw this place open up, I thought Carrabba's would have competition, but now we are thinking Sullivan's will have to step their game up to keep us from going to Luciano's for a nice meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Zeppole
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lasagna
Photo of Luciano's Ristorante Italiano - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pometini

bbDXcnGrjUFOQnT6p7BlWA.text: I don't want to write a long review because no one really reads those. This place was delicious! We sampled a meatball from Luciano's at a Yelper party a few months ago, so when we were deciding on a nice dinner place, this was our top pick. Valet parking is complimentary, but you can also park in the deck right next store. We grabbed a table outside,cute patio and we even heard some live music from the bar across the street. Semi pricey drink options but a very good mule. With a pasta special and eggplant parm we left stuffed and satisfied. Our waitress was friendly and speedy. I will remember this place the next time I want to treat myself to some Italian!  Oh and if you check-in, you get to use a 10% off deal. Not a bad perk!

6tkX8eOynN2rvRHpeoG2cg.text: It is very simple. This is the best pasta I have been able to find since I visited Roma - the lasagne manages to be authentic with the lightest noodles you can imagine - sauce perfect and not overpowering. Do not miss this place.

M0qn7_K2l2XUh9C6p9yAqA.text: Veal Osso Buco is the newest on their entrees list. A must try! Tender meat and tasty sauce made it satisfying. Wine bar and great food combined!
